title: Operations Analyst
description:
*Joining King’s Hawaiian makes you part of our `ohana (family). We are a family-owned business for over seventy years, respecting our roots while thinking about our future as we continue to grow and care for our customers and the communities we serve. Our `ohana members build an environment of inclusivity as they freely collaborate, pursue learning through curiosity, and explore innovation as critical thinkers. Beyond that, we are also passionate about supporting the long-term health and well-being of our employees and their families. If you’re excited to rise with our team, come and join our `ohana!*

Working as an individual contributor under the Continuous Improvement Manager, the Operations Analyst will deliver value to Kings Hawaiian by providing accessible, accurate, and timely performance data and reporting to Operations using tools like Power BI, SQL and Python. The Operations Analyst will work collaboratively with the Continuous Improvement, Production and Data teams to garner insights, identify and scope improvement opportunities, and provide analytical support during opportunity realization. They will also drive the design, improvement, execution, and automation of dashboards and reporting tools with the Operations teams as well as provide guidance and support in the pursuit of self-service tool development. Employees in this position may interact with their leader several times a week to receive guidance and feedback. Some non-routine activities may require their leader’s advance approval, but routine decisions within the general scope of the role may be made independently.

ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Performance Measurement & Reporting

* Ensure timely and accurate reporting of key operational performance metrics.
* Maintain data integrity by collaborating with Data teams to improve data collection, cleanliness, and governance.
* Interpret operational data with a deep understanding of its real-world implications.
* Serve as a key resource for data analytics needs across Continuous Improvement, Operations Excellence, and Production teams.

Performance Analysis & Opportunity Identification

* Analyze operational data to identify, quantify, and prioritize performance improvement opportunities.
* Partner with stakeholders to validate findings and contextualize insights.
* Provide analytical support for the execution and tracking of improvement initiatives.
* Assist in the development of capital project business cases and value realization tracking, continuously refining valuation methodologies.

Tool Ownership & Support

* Act as the subject matter expert (SME) for frontline performance tracking tools (e.g., RedZone, SAP Digital Manufacturing).
* Lead the design, enhancement, and automation of dashboards and reporting tools.
* Support the development of self-service analytics capabilities across Operations.

Cross-Functional Collaboration

* Communicate insights and recommendations effectively across all levels of the organization—from frontline teams to senior leadership.
* Provide ad hoc analytical support for strategic initiatives within the Continuous Improvement and Operations Excellence functions.
* Perform other duties as assigned, aligned with the scope and intent of the role.

BASIC AND PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS (EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE)

* Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Engineering, Industrial Operations, or a related field; or equivalent relevant experience.
* Minimum of 2 years of experience in data analysis, continuous improvement, or a related operational role.
* Highly Proficient in Data Analysis including significant experience and comfort with Python and SQL or other related data analysis skills
* Proficient in Data Visualization tools, including Tableau and Power BI
* Highly Proficient in the Microsoft Suite, including Excel, PowerPoint, Teams, and others

ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS (JOB SKILLS, ABILITIES, KNOWLEDGE)

* Understanding of traditional manufacturing metrics preferred (OEE, yield, productivity, etc.)
* Clear communicator, able to speak to all levels of the organization
* Expert attention to detail and natural ownership of work
* Highly curious and natural drive to seek understanding
* Self starter that can work independently, but also able to work collaboratively with various stakeholders
* Ability to travel up to 10% of the time.
* Ability to consistently demonstrate King’s values of excellence, dignity, saying it like it is in a way it can be heard; and curiosity, collaboration, critical thinking and emotional intelligence.

*King's Hawaiian is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for our ohana.*

title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
When you join the team at Unum, you become part of an organization committed to helping you thrive.

Here, we work to provide the employee benefits and service solutions that enable employees at our client companies to thrive throughout life’s moments. And this starts with ensuring that every one of our team members enjoys opportunities to succeed both professionally and personally. To enable this, we provide:

* Award-winning culture
* Inclusion and diversity as a priority
* Performance Based Incentive Plans
* Competitive benefits package that includes: Health, Vision, Dental, Short & Long-Term Disability
* Generous PTO (including paid time to volunteer!)
* Up to 9.5% 401(k) employer contribution
* Mental health support
* Career advancement opportunities
* Student loan repayment options
* Tuition reimbursement
* Flexible work environments

### ***\\*All the benefits listed above are subject to the terms of their individual Plans*** **.**

And that’s just the beginning…

With 10,000 employees helping more than 39 million people worldwide, every role at Unum is meaningful and impacts the lives of our customers. Whether you’re directly supporting a growing family, or developing online tools to help navigate a difficult loss, customers are counting on the combined talents of our entire team. Help us help others, and join Team Unum today!

**General Summary:**
--------------------

The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst serves as a subject matter expert in data analysis, visualization, and strategic insight generation. This role leads complex analytics projects, translates data into actionable business intelligence, and collaborates closely with cross-functional teams. The analyst also supports contract negotiations, provides market and competitive insights, and ensures accurate reporting for billing and governance. A key part of this role includes mentoring junior analysts and driving the growth of analytics capabilities across the organization.
  
  
This is a hybrid role that requires a minimum of 2x per week on site at our Portland, ME or Chattanooga, TN campuses.

**Job Specifications**

* Bachelor's Degree preferred, and/or equivalent experience
* 6+ years' experience with demonstrated success at a BI Analyst II level or comparable data analytics related field
* Excellent knowledge of analytics programming languages (SQL/R/Python)
* Excellent knowledge of modern BI toolsets (Tableau, Alteryx, Power BI, or equivalent)
* In-depth understanding of data profiling, statistical analysis and data modeling concepts
* Adept in extracting and leveraging data out of data warehouse, transactional databases, object stores & API based environments
* Demonstrated ability to translate business needs into technical solutions
* Ability to embrace change, adapt to the unexpected, and focus energies, people, and solutions on practical and positive results
* Demonstrated problem solving skills
* Strong communications skills with the ability to influence various levels of leaders using data and logic
* Strong and proven ability to effectively mentor, develop and coach others
* Aptitude and drive to learn new technologies and analysis techniques
* Is comfortable taking responsibility for the design & implementation of technical solutions
* Strong team player; able to work effectively within a team and more broadly with people from a variety of backgrounds and areas across the organization.

**Principal Duties and Responsibilities**

* Utilize business knowledge to understand business needs and provide technical analytics and solutions to meet these needs
* Conduct moderate to complex data profiling and analysis to evaluate data sources to determine the best source for business information
* Acquiring, transforming and translating data into actionable dashboards, reports, algorithms or datasets that has a substantial impact on the functional area of support
* Performing moderate to complex statistical analysis and presenting findings to guide, influence and advise leadership, including at times senior leaders
* Collaborate with data engineers to perform data validation and testing activities as appropriate
* Develop and build upon existing expertise knowledge of the insurance industry, company and competitor landscape
* Develop and build upon existing expertise of data stored in company databases, as well as emerging trends in business intelligence technologies
* Works directly with internal customers to refine requirements and validate output to ensure solutions will meet expectations
* Provide mentoring, coaching and developmental support to lower-level BI Analysts

Unum and Colonial Life are part of Unum Group, a Fortune 500 company and leading provider of employee benefits to companies worldwide. Headquartered in Chattanooga, TN, with international offices in Ireland, Poland and the UK, Unum also has significant operations in Portland, ME, and Baton Rouge, LA - plus over 35 US field offices. Colonial Life is headquartered in Columbia, SC, with over 40 field offices nationwide.

Unum is an equal opportunity employer, considering all qualified applicants and employees for hiring, placement, and advancement, without regard to a person's race, color, religion, national origin, age, genetic information, military status, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or protected veteran status.

The base salary range for applicants for this position is listed below. Unless actual salary is indicated above in the job description, actual pay will be based on skill, geographical location and experience.

$89,400.00-$183,500.00

Additionally, Unum offers a portfolio of benefits and rewards that are competitive and comprehensive including healthcare benefits (health, vision, dental), insurance benefits (short & long-term disability), performance-based incentive plans, paid time off, and a 401(k) retirement plan with an employer match up to 5% and an additional 4.5% contribution whether you contribute to the plan or not. All benefits are subject to the terms and conditions of individual Plans.

title: eDiscovery Analyst
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*

Job Category

Global Affairs

Job Details

**About Salesforce**

We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.

Salesforce, a global leader in CRM and recognized as a top workplace, is seeking a driven **eDiscovery Analyst** to join our dynamic Legal and Corporate Affairs (LCA) Operations team. The LCA Ops team is at the forefront of supporting all legal practices in digital transformation, knowledge management, and delivering best-in-class eDiscovery services. This role offers the opportunity to work with ground breaking technology and contribute to a fast-paced, innovative environment. The eDiscovery team plays a meaningful role in providing data collection, processing, and analysis services, supporting legal and regulatory matters with efficiency and accuracy. This is a hybrid role and works out of the Atlanta office.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Act as the primary project manager for all eDiscovery matters.
* Administer the entire Electronic Discovery Reference Model (EDRM) lifecycle.
* Serve as the central point of contact, collaborating closely with both internal and external partners.
* Ensure clear communication and seamless delivery of eDiscovery services.
* Maintain detailed documentation and processing of legal requests.
* Leverage innovative technology to support data and device collections, processing, and analysis.
* Maintain accuracy and efficiency throughout the entire eDiscovery process.

**Required Skills/Experience**
------------------------------

* 3-5 years of hands-on experience in eDiscovery, with a strong understanding of the entire EDRM lifecycle. Industry-specific certifications (e.g., Relativity Certified Administrator, ACEDS, CDFE, etc.) preferred.
* Demonstrated ability to manage complex eDiscovery projects from inception to completion, including planning, execution, monitoring, and closing.
* Proficient knowledge of Relativity and familiarity with a range of eDiscovery and forensic software (e.g., Nuix, Cellebrite, Google Vault, etc.).
* Working knowledge of data collection, data storage, and chain of custody standard methodologies.
* Familiarity with system administration on macOS, Microsoft Windows, Linux/Unix operating systems, and mobile device management (Android, iOS).
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Strong interpersonal and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with internal and external partners.
* Strong organizational and documentation skills, with the ability to independently manage and report on tasks.
* Ability to track metrics, analyze data, and provide regular reports to management.
* Ability to coordinate multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment. Highly adaptable and able to respond to changing priorities and time lines.
* Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving abilities.
* Basic understanding of legal concepts and procedures related to eDiscovery.
* Knowledge of data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).
* Previous experience working in a corporate legal department, law firm, or eDiscovery vendor environment is preferred.
* Bachelor degree in a related field

We have a public-facing website https://salesforcebenefits.com/ that explains our various benefits, including medical, dental, 401k, ESPP, generous parental leave, adoption assistance, fertility benefits, and more. Visit for the full breakdown!

Accommodations

If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .

Posting Statement

Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.

In the United States, compensation offered will be determined by factors such as location, job level, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Certain roles may be eligible for incentive compensation, equity, and benefits. Salesforce offers a variety of benefits to help you live well including: time off programs, medical, dental, vision, mental health support, paid parental leave, life and disability insurance, 401(k), and an employee stock purchasing program. More details about company benefits can be found at the following link: https://www.salesforcebenefits.com.

title: Senior Analyst, Strategic Analytics
description:
**What’s Under the Hood**

DriveTime Family of Brands includes SilverRock, which provides quality warranty and ancillary products, and a customer-friendly claims process. SilverRock offers a variety of ancillary products and administrative services encompassing everything from GAP coverage to vehicle theft and GPS tracking to dealership fleet management. Our ancillary product expertise is proven with over 1 million service contracts, products, and warranties, and over $300 million in claims.

**That’s Nice, But What’s the Job?**

***This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. Individuals with temporary visas or who need sponsorship now or in the future are not eligible for hire at this time.***

In long, our Senior Analyst, Strategic Analytics are responsible for:

* Innovate on existing products and processes while using emerging technologies and data analysis to identify new opportunities to improve customer experience and profitability in our ancillary products division.
* Create in-depth analyses, collaborate with stakeholders, and leverage resources skillfully to capitalize on those new opportunities
* Create, maintain, and automate reporting to help partner teams produce value-add strategies and optimize their business segment.
* Demonstrate strong communication skills in making recommendations to senior executives across DriveTime’s family of companies.
* Constructing in-depth quantitative analysis by processing, manipulating, and studying large datasets by leveraging strong Excel skills and coding languages such as SQL, Snowflake, and R.
* Designing, developing, testing, and implementing new products and solutions.
* Effectively communicating with concise insights and/or visualizations utilizing software such as Tableau while partnering collaboratively with colleagues and senior leaders in DriveTime.
* Being self-driven and able to take initiative to further the success of the business.

**So What Kind of Folks Are We Looking for?**

**Killer analytical and reporting abilities.** You’ll need the capability to analyze data and in return, prepare timely reports on your findings.

**A mind for the details.** Okay we know “detail-oriented” is on about every job description – but we really mean it!

**Intellectual curiosity.** Why? What? How? Do you find yourself always wanting to learn more and broaden your knowledge base? If so, this could be the role for you.

**Passionate and goal oriented.** We are looking for someone that is enthusiastic about their work and is passionate about not only meeting their goals but exceeding them.

Good verbal and written communication skills.

**The Specifics.**

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in a quantitative field such as economics, finance, statistics, engineering, computer information systems or other STEM field.
* 3+ years of experience in data, financial, and/or strategic analytics.
* Experience using analysis to create value-added strategies and make recommendations to the business to improve organizational performance
* Exceptional problem-solving skills, collaborative teamwork, intellectual horsepower, curiosity, initiative, and attention to detail.
* Strong statistical skills and experience focused on business decision making and problem solving.
* Experience managing multiple project streams.
* Demonstrated skill in SQL/Snowflake and extensive experience developing analysis in Excel.

**So What About the Perks? Perks matter**

* **We** **take a hybrid work approach,** finding balance between the benefits of in-person and work-from-home environments. This position has an on-site expectation of a minimum of three days a week.
* **Medical, dental, and vision, oh my!** DriveTime Family of Brands covers a sizable amount of insurance premiums to ensure our employees receive top-tier healthcare coverage.
* **But Wait, There’s More.** 401(K), Company paid life insurance policy, short and long-term disability coverage to name a few.
* **Growth Opportunities.** You grow, I grow, we all grow! But seriously, DriveTime Family of Brands is committed to providing its employees with every opportunity to grow professionally with roughly over 1,000 employees promoted year over year.
* **Tuition Reimbursement.** We’re as passionate about your professional development as you are. With that, we’ll put our money where our mouth is.
* **Wellness Program.** Health is wealth! This program includes self-guided coaching and journeys, cash incentives and discounts on your medical premiums through engaging in fun activities!
* **Gratitude is Green.** We offer competitive pay across the organization, because, well… money matters!

* **In-House Gym.** We want our employees to be the best versions of themselves. So come early, take a break in your day or finish strong with a workout!
* **Give Us a Reason (or not), and We’ll Celebrate.** Regardless of whether there is a holiday or not, we are finding ways to kick back and enjoy each other’s company outside of day-to-day work.
* **Smart-Casual Dress.** Come dressed in jeans (you’ll fit right in with the rest of us).

* **Paid Time Off.** Not just lip service: we work hard, to play hard ! Paid time off includes (for all full-time roles) wellness days, holidays, and good ole' fashioned YOU time! For our Part-timers, don't fear you get some time too...vacation time is available - the more you work, the more you earn!

**Anything Else? Absolutely.**

DriveTime Family of Brands is Great Place to Work Certified! And get this: 90% of our rockstar employees say they feel right at home here. We could spend a lot of time having you read about ALL our awards, but we’ll save time (and practice some humility) just naming a few others; Comparably Awards: Best Company for Diversity, Best Company Culture and Best Company Leadership, oh and don’t forget Phoenix Business Journal Healthiest Employers (okay, we’ll stop there)!

Hiring is contingent upon successful completion of our background and drug screening process. DriveTime is a drug-free, tobacco-free workplace and an Equal Opportunity Employer.

And when it comes to hiring, we don't just look for the right person for the job, we seek out the right person for DriveTime. Buckle up for plenty of opportunities to grow in a professional, fun, and high-energy environment!

title: HR Data Analyst
description:
*We’re committed to being the clean energy leader in Louisiana. By investing in renewables like solar and utilizing carbon capture and sequestration technology to make our air cleaner, we’re in this for the long haul, because our state and future generations depend on it. Come be a part of our journey at Cleco where we're Energizing Your Tomorrow.*

The HR Data Analyst II is responsible to collect, analyze, and report HR data, metrics, and statistics related to recruitment, retention, payroll, benefits, demographics, and legal compliance. Utilize data results to make recommendations and/or identify trends based on Key Performance Indicators (KPI’s), market information, or business strategy. Prepare and deliver required reporting and filings. Perform employee data management and analysis processes to ensure that data is secure and maintained consistent with company policies and privacy regulations. Assist with executing all activities associated with position and headcount management.

Key Responsibilities

* Champions a corporate culture that emphasizes transparency, integrity, safety, environmental responsibility, employee development, diversity and inclusion, customer service, and operational excellence.
* Utilize strong analytical and leadership skills to coordinate, facilitate, and implement processes relating to human resources reporting.
* Collects, analyzes, and compiles data and statistics from the human resource information system (HRIS), as well as other sources, to identify trends and patterns with attention to recruitment, hiring practices, retention/turnover, compliance with employment laws and regulations, diversity, as well as other HR related operations.
* Compiles benefits-related reporting for vendor data requests, non-discrimination testing, and data reconciliations for plan audits.
* Prepares reports of data results, presenting and explaining findings to senior leadership.
* Identifies and recommends reasonable short- and long-term goals, milestones, and benchmarks for key performance indicators (KPI’s).
* Work with internal and external stakeholders for data retrieval, analysis, and reporting.
* Respond to and resolve ad-hoc HR reporting inquiries about the organization and its employees.
* Assist with position and headcount management
* Maintain integrity and confidentiality of departmental records and employee documentation.

Qualifications

Required Education, Skills & Experience

* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Statistics, CIS, Mathematics, or related field
* 3-5+ years of related experience
* Committed to confidentiality and ability to handle and disseminate sensitive data.
* Must have effective detail-orientation or attention to detail.
* Proficient analytical and problem-solving skills to parse data and information to develop rational solutions with focus on making sense of facts and figures. Use logical thinking practices to identify trends or challenges.
* Experience with Workday or other HRIS/Payroll system(s) a plus
* Proficient in Microsoft Office, with strong Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skills
* Experience with a business intelligence platform (such as MS Power BI) a plus
* Progression to this level is strictly restricted based on critical individual capabilities and business requirements; must be supported by market survey data.
* Licenses and Certifications

Key Competencies

* Balances stakeholders
* Builds effective teams
* Business insight
* Communicates effectively
* Courage
* Demonstrates awareness
* Drives Results
* Drives Vision and Purpose
* Ensures Accountability
* Instills trust
* Nimble learning
* Plans and Aligns
* Strategic mindset

May perform other duties as assigned.

Salary dependent on experience, skills, education and training.

title: Business Analyst III (Digital Change Lead)
description:
**About the Team**

We’re not traditional change management—we’re Digital Change Management, redefining digital advancement through AI, data technologies, and human-centered design. As technology evolves, we lead bold, strategic change that shapes the future of our business and employee experience.

We bring a people-first approach to aligning technology with business value, maximizing Zachry’s digital solution investments. In partnership with the Digital Enablement team, we drive adoption and deliver transformative change across the organization.

The Digital Change Lead reports to the Sr. Manager of Digital Change Management and plays a key role in making this vision a reality.

If you're passionate about digital innovation and ready to make a real impact—join us. We’re not just keeping up with change—we’re leading it.

  

**JOB QUALIFICATIONS**

* 4+ years of experience delivering end-to-end change management for complex, high-profile initiatives, ideally in fast-paced or consulting environments.
* Bachelor’s degree in business, communications, or a related field (advanced degree or consulting experience preferred).
* Proven expertise in change management methodologies (e.g., PROSCI) and all phases of the change process, including stakeholder analysis, impact assessments, communications, and adoption planning.
* Strong background in strategic program execution, stakeholder engagement, and cross-functional collaboration.
* Experience with Oracle Cloud HCM implementations or digital transformation initiatives.
* Fluent in English; able to work effectively in a multicultural, team-oriented environment.
* Must pass a post-offer background check, including a drug screen.
* Familiarity with AI integration in workflows, decision-making, or automation, and a forward-thinking mindset toward emerging technologies.

**PREFERRED JOB QUALIFICATIONS**

* Advanced degree in business, communications, I/O psychology or a related field (or consulting experience).
* ACMP’s Certified Change Management Professional (CCMP™) or working toward certification.
* Proficiency with multiple change management tools and methodologies (e.g., ACMP Standard, Prosci ADKAR, Kotter, Lewin).
* Strong project management background
* Digital marketing experience

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES (to be successful in this role)**

* Skilled in developing and delivering strategic communications, executive presentations, and training using digital and video platforms.
* Excellent facilitation, communication, and persuasion skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.
* Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving capabilities.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, especially advanced PowerPoint and Excel; creative development skills are a plus.
* Deep understanding of change management techniques, tools, and stakeholder engagement strategies.
* Skilled in conflict resolution, active listening, and consensus building.
* Demonstrated business acumen with strong organizational and planning abilities.
* Collaborative team player who thrives in fast-paced, dynamic environments.
* Self-motivated and proactive, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and maintain focus on outcomes.
* Comfortable advising executives and navigating tight timelines without compromising quality.
* Data-driven and creative, with a passion for enhancing the employee experience and promoting fact-based decision-making.
* Curious, adaptable, and committed to continuous learning and improvement.
* A natural change agent with a consulting mindset and a drive to challenge the status quo.

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS**

Physical requirements include occasional lifting/carrying of 5 pounds; visual acuity, speech and hearing; hand and eye coordination and manual dexterity necessary to operate a computer keyboard and basic office equipment. Subject to sitting, standing, reaching, walking, twisting, and kneeling to perform the essential functions. Working conditions are primarily inside an office environment.

**WORK ENVIRONMENT**

Will work in a general office environment with a hybrid work schedule. Employees are required to work at least three (3) days a week on site. Remote work or working at the Zachry Houston office possible, based on the scenario. Capable of operating and functioning in a fast-paced work environment. Must possess a vision (corrected or uncorrected) that allows for clear visibility from a distance of 20 inches or less.

Zachry Group is America's pacesetter in turnkey construction, engineering, maintenance, turnaround and fabrication services in the power, energy, chemicals, manufacturing and industrial sectors. We work with customers to plan, build and renew their most critical facilities, so they can achieve their immediate and long-term goals, all at the highest safety standards. We operate 35 offices, with an average of 20,000 employees working in more than 400 locations nationwide, united by shared sets of values and the desire to deliver the very best outcome for our customers. Visit www.zachrygroup.com for more information.

**ZACHRY GROUP** is dedicated to providing a Safe and Drug Free work environment; and is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

**Company Benefits** : Meaningful Work ; Team-Based Culture ; Opportunity for Growth

title: HCD Planning Analyst
description:
**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS****:** Works under the direction of an assigned supervisor in Housing and Community Development (HCD). Monitors special development projects and various programs as required. Assists in the development of resources and programs to meet community needs. Develops planning projection for grant and other programs as needed. Assists in the development of plans, including annual plans, agency plans, neighborhood plans, and others as assigned. Prepares check requests relating to programs as needed. Prepares various required reports according to government regulations which may involve researching, analyzing, and compiling a vast amount of data. Inputs and maintains computerized data. Assists in monitoring various databases related to housing and community development to insure that current and accurate information is available for use by the entire division. Collects data and tracks progress for neighborhoods targeted for redevelopment. Utilizes geographic information systems to analyze data and monitor revitalization activities. Researches and evaluates community needs from compiled data. Coordinates and documents inspections for facilities and properties as needed.  
  
**OTHER FUNCTIONS****:**

* Performs additional functions (essential or otherwise) which may be assigned.

  

**TYPICAL PHYSICAL DEMANDS****:** Primarily desk work. Requires ability to operate general office equipment such as a personal computer, Must be able to communicate both verbally and in writing. Requires the ability to read and interpret federal regulations.  
  
**TYPICAL WORKING CONDITIONS****:** Work is performed in an office environment which involves contact with the staff and public.  
  
Bachelor's degree in City and Regional Planning, Public Administration, or closely related field and three (3) years' experience in community development programs and planning activities; or any combination of experience and training which enables one to perform the essential job functions. Working experience with Microsoft Office products preferred.

The City Charter requires that City Employees must establish residence within Shelby County within six (6) months from date of Employment. Proof of residence will be required at the time of hire. The City Charter requires that City Employees, with the EXECEPTION of “first responders”, must establish residence within Shelby County within six (6) months from their date of Employment. Proof of residence will be required at the time of hire. As defined by Tennessee House Bill 105, "first responder means paid, full-time law enforcement officers, firefighters, and emergency medical personnel and dispatchers of law enforcement, fire and emergency medical service departments."  
  
The City of Memphis is committed to providing access and reasonable accommodation in its services, programs, activities, and employment for individuals with disabilities. title: Data Business Analyst II - Hybrid
description:
Our Fortune 500 company is driving a digital transformation and looking for forward-thinking innovators to disrupt how our industry thinks about and uses technology. As one of the world's leading employee benefits providers, we help millions of people gain affordable access to benefits that help them protect their families, their finances and their futures.

Are you an asker of questions, a solver of problems, and a challenger of the status quo? Our mission is to provide a differentiated customer experience and exceed the expectations people have of technology at any company — not just insurers.

We are seeking individuals to join our team of talented IT professionals who share never-ending passion and an unwavering focus on our customer experience. Team members comfortable working in an agile, fast-paced, and delivery-focused environment thrive in our environment where we value an entrepreneurial spirit and those who challenge the status-quo.

Unum is changing, and we’re excited about what’s next. Join us.

**General Summary:**
--------------------

The Data Business Analyst serves as a critical liaison between the Scrum team and business stakeholders, ensuring alignment and clarity around business requirements. This role is responsible for eliciting, defining, and documenting requirements, including the development of clear acceptance criteria.
  
  
Additionally, the analyst may conduct data profiling, analysis, and mapping for tasks ranging from simple to moderately complex. This position involves performing moderately complex data analysis, preparation, and visualization. Leveraging both technical and domain expertise, the analyst translates data into actionable insights that empower teams and leadership to make informed decisions. The role requires minimal supervision and demonstrates proficiency with relevant tools and technologies within the data domain.
  
  
The ideal candidate is a creative and analytical thinker with a strong passion for data. They will collaborate closely with Principal Business Analysts, Product Owners, Delivery Leads, Data Engineers, and business units to gather and validate requirements. Active participation in work estimation and delivery planning is also expected.

**Job Specifications:**

* Bachelor's Degree preferred, and/or equivalent experience
* 2+ years of experience with demonstrated success at the Associate level in Data Analysis or equivalent experience, and working as part of an Agile team
* Takes an innovative approach to problem-solving
* Strong written communication skills to document and communicate requirements
* Knowledge of SQL
* Understanding of data profiling and analysis concepts, including data anomalies and data mapping activities.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks by paying close attention to detail
* Ability to embrace change, adapt to the unexpected, and focus energies, people, and solutions on practical and positive results
* Strong team player; able to work effectively within a team and more broadly with people from a variety of backgrounds and areas across the organization.
* Self-motivated and results-oriented

**Principal Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with stakeholders across business and technical teams (e.g., architects, developers, UX, engineers) to define and refine user stories and requirements with clear acceptance criteria.
* Translate business objectives into user stories, workflows, and data-driven features that support modernization efforts and the consolidation of legacy applications.
* Lead backlog grooming and decomposition, ensuring alignment with enterprise quality standards, planning horizons, and data integrity across tools.
* Elicit and document business requirements through interviews, workshops, workflow analysis, and systems documentation
* Participate in and support Agile ceremonies, including daily stand-ups, planning, retrospectives, and test activities.
* Serve as a change agent by identifying, evaluating, and implementing process improvements and innovations that reduce waste and increase delivery efficiency.
* Conduct data profiling and analysis to evaluate data sources to determine the best source for business information.
* Complete source to target data mapping specifications (e.g. source to target can be from one DBMS table to another DBMS table, from a DBMS table into a canonical message structure, etc.)
* Develop and maintain knowledge of the insurance industry.
* Develop and maintain knowledge of data stored in company databases.
* Adhere to approved architectural standards.
* Thinks with the mind of the end customer at all times, ensuring solutions seek to improve the customer experience and delight their customers.

title: Risk Management Data Analyst (100% Remote)
description:
#### **Who We Are**

As the United States’ largest light industrial staffing company and the first workforce-as-a-service provider, our digital-first approach to staffing is rooted in a rich history of delivering high-quality, scalable workforce solutions to the organizations driving the American supply chain. Our colleagues are guided by our purpose of ***Championing People, Unlocking Potential*** and bring this to life every day as they help put hundreds of thousands of people to work at tens of thousands of companies across the country.

The foundation of our culture is built upon a bridge to better, offering our colleagues rewarding and growth-oriented experiences that positively impact lives and businesses in innovative and meaningful ways.

  

**Job Summary**

The Risk Management Data Analyst is responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to support the identification, assessment, and mitigation of risk across the organization. This role provides essential technical and analytical support to the Risk Management department. The ideal candidate brings strong analytical capabilities, proficiency with data tools and reporting platforms, and a solid understanding of risk frameworks and business operations.

  

**Your Role & Responsibilities**

* Responsible for data input evaluation, on-going system maintenance, report generation and build-out of RMIS via Riskonnect; continuously assess system performance and recommend enhancements.
* Serve as the Riskonnect system administrator, managing coordination with the platform vendor, related Employbridge vendors, and internal cross-functional partners.
* Act as the internal RMIS subject matter expert, supporting strategic initiatives and the development of risk management solutions.
* Generate and analyze risk-related reports from RMIS to identify and interpret loss trends and support data-driven decision-making.
* Design, maintain, and enhance dashboards and reports within Riskonnect.
* Develop and manage Power BI dashboards and reports.
* Create and update advanced Excel-based analytical reports, as needed.
* Maintains confidentiality of all data records, reports and any incidental information collected.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver data analytics aligned with risk and safety metrics.
* Support additional tasks and special projects as assigned by the VP of Risk Management and Analytics.

  

**Preferred Education & Experience**

* Bachelor’s degree required; a degree in Business, Data Analytics, Risk Management, or a related field is preferred.
* Proven experience maintaining, building, and troubleshooting Salesforce-based platforms; experience with Riskonnect is strongly preferred.
* Proficiency in building and maintaining Power BI reports and dashboards is required.
* Advanced Excel skills, including data analysis, pivot tables, and formula creation.
* Prior experience in risk management, insurance, or a related field is preferred.

  

**Competencies (Skills & Knowledge You’ll Bring)**

* Strong organizational skills with the ability to self-manage multiple priorities, routine responsibilities, and urgent issues as they arise.
* Exceptional attention to detail in both work execution and professional communication.
* Reliable and professional point of contact for internal teams and external partners.
* Sound decision-making abilities in both commercial and interpersonal settings.
* Proficient in leveraging technology platforms to support data-driven decision-making.

  

The anticipated annual base salary for this position in the US is $60,000 to $70,000. This range does not include any other compensation components or other benefits that an individual may be eligible for. The actual base salary offered depends on a variety of factors, which may include as applicable, the qualifications of the individual applicant for the position, years of relevant experience, specific and unique skills, level of education attained, certifications or other professional licenses held, and the location in which the applicant lives and/or from which they will be performing the job.

  

**Employbridge is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to diversity and inclusion. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, disability, military or veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.**

  

Employbridge offers a competitive benefits package which includes Medical/Dental/Vision, prescription drug benefits, 401(k), paid time off and holidays, a wellness program, and incentive programs. We also offer a variety of career paths and encourage promotion from within.

Equal Opportunity Employer  
This employer is required to notify all applicants of their rights pursuant to federal employment laws. For further information, please review the Know Your Rights notice from the Department of Labor.

title: Senior PACS Analyst - Clinical Imaging Radiology (REMOTE)
description:
At NTT DATA, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees are key factors in our company's growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay ahead of the competition. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA and for the people who work here.
  
  
NOTE: This is a US based, W-2 project. All candidates will be paid through NTT DATA only.  
  
Job Summary:  
We are seeking highly experienced **Senior PACS Analysts** to join a specialized team focused on resolving major system outages across enterprise imaging environments. This is a hybrid role; primarily REMOTE with travel estimated 1x/quarter.  
  
This role is ideal for professionals with deep expertise in **Merge and/or Change Healthcare PACS, a strong grasp of DICOM standards, and experience supporting both radiology and cardiology imaging systems**. Unlike implementation-focused roles, this team will be the first line of defense during critical system failures, ensuring rapid recovery and continuity of care.  
  
Key Responsibilities:

* Provide expert-level support during major PACS outages across multiple healthcare facilities
* Troubleshoot and resolve complex DICOM and imaging workflow issues
* Support both radiology and cardiology PACS systems
* Collaborate with internal teams to stabilize and restore imaging systems
* Document incident response procedures and contribute to knowledge sharing
* Coordinate with modality vendors and clinical teams during high-impact events
* Participate in a rotating on-call schedule for emergency support

Required Qualifications:

* 8+ years of experience in PACS administration or support
* Proven expertise with Merge PACS and/or Change Healthcare PACS
* Strong understanding of DICOM standards, imaging workflows, and modality integration
* Experience supporting radiology and cardiology PACS
* Excellent problem-solving and communication skills
* Ability to work independently in high-pressure situations
* Associate or Bachelor’s degree in a related field (or equivalent experience)

Preferred Qualifications:

* Experience with ancillary or post-processing imaging applications
* Familiarity with enterprise imaging environments
* Prior experience in incident response or outage management

**About NTT DATA**  
  
NTT DATA is a $30 billion trusted global innovator of business and technology services. We serve 75% of the Fortune Global 100 and are committed to helping clients innovate, optimize and transform for long-term success. As a Global Top Employer, we have diverse experts in more than 50 countries and a robust partner ecosystem of established and start-up companies. Our services include business and technology consulting, data and artificial intelligence, industry solutions, as well as the development, implementation and management of applications, infrastructure and connectivity. We are one of the leading providers of digital and AI infrastructure in the world. NTT DATA is a part of NTT Group, which invests over $3.6 billion each year in R&D to help organizations and society move confidently and sustainably into the digital future. Visit us at us.nttdata.com  
  
NTT DATA endeavors to make https://us.nttdata.com accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact us at https://us.nttdata.com/en/contact-us . This contact information is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications. NTT DATA is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. title: Senior Analyst, Brand Analytics - SONIC
description:
**Brand Analytics****Senior** **Analyst**

This position is critical to understanding brand business performance in order to help develop strategies and recommendations to inform future brand direction. The expectation is that this individual will report on information critical to business insights and decision-making. The Analyst on the Brand Data & Analytics team will be a key resource for the brand in answering business questions efficiently and effectively for all cross functional partners.

**Responsibilities:**

* **Insight Generation –** Generate insights that improve the business through linking various data sources (e.g., sales, competitor, market, customer, etc.)

* **Business Analysis –** Analyze brand performance and sales trends, including promotional and test analyses

* **KPI Reporting –** Create and maintain reports that assess ongoing business performance, leading indicators, and explanatory factors

* **Ad Hoc Reporting –** Develop, execute and deliver reports based on brand business requirements for various stakeholders across the organization

* **Brand Performance –** Analyze and monitor key metrics across brand health, product performance, and guest experience to assist in analyzing, understanding, and recapping the impact of overall business performance and/or promotional marketing programs

* **Strategy Consulting –** Provide guidance and strategic recommendations on promotional marketing initiatives across all levels of the organization, utilizing both quantitative and qualitative measures; present strategic recommendations based on sound financial analysis to large and small audiences across all levels of the organization

* **Relationship Management –** Develop and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders and partners while collaborating effectively across the organization to achieve objectives

* **Project Management –** Ensure that all medium/long term projects are implemented on time and achieve business goals and objectives

**EDUCATION QUALIFICATIONS**

**Required Minimum:** Bachelor’s Degree (preferably in Business Management, Data & Analytics, Marketing, Finance, or other relevant discipline). Master’s degree preferred.

**EXPERIENCE QUALIFICATION**

**Required Minimum:** 2-3 years relevant experience in relevant field

**REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE,** **SKILLS** **or ABILITIES**

* Results driven with the ability to perform successfully with limited supervision

* Have the ability to compile sound business recommendations

* Strong problem solving and analytical skills with the ability to research, reconcile, and arrive at conclusions

* Time management skills in order to prioritize and manage deadlines

* Comfort working in the fast-paced QSR segment with the ability to turn around deliverables for senior management with short timeframes

* Proactive, team player but also able to work independently

* Excellent verbal, written communication, and presentation skills

* Excellent interpersonal skills, positive attitude, and effective collaborator committed to getting the job done

* Proficiency with Microsoft Office applications, with expertise in Excel (e.g., pivot tables, advanced functions, formulas, filtering, etc.)

* Relational database proficiency with SQL experience

  
Inspire is a multi-brand restaurant company whose portfolio includes more than 33,000 Arby’s, Baskin-Robbins, Buffalo Wild Wings, Dunkin’, Jimmy John’s, and SONIC restaurants worldwide.  
  
We’re made up of some of the world’s most iconic restaurant brands, but we’re much more than just a restaurant company. We’re a team of hundreds of thousands who individually and collectively are changing the way people eat, drink, and gather around the table. We know that food is much more than a staple—it’s an experience. At Inspire, that’s our purpose: to ignite and nourish flavorful experiences.

title: Corporate Real Estate Analyst, Mergers & Acquisitions
description:
**Work Schedule**

Standard Office Hours (40/wk)

**Environmental Conditions**

Office

**Job Description**

Join us at Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. as a Corporate Real Estate Analyst, Mergers & Acquisitions, in Pittsburgh, PA, USA! This is an outstanding opportunity to contribute to our global M&A activities, where you will provide outstanding functional support to the Corporate Development team. You will be instrumental in ensuring flawless due diligence, integration, and disposition of real estate assets. This role requires someone who thrives in a fast-paced, highly confidential environment and can manage global projects with ease.

**Key Responsibilities:**
-------------------------

* Collaborate on multiple confidential M&A projects with Corporate Development, legal teams, and external partners.
* Access data rooms to review and abstract all real estate documents.
* Conduct detailed contractual reviews of acquisition or disposition real estate-related contracts.
* Construct comprehensive due diligence reports and property portfolio summaries.
* Present and analyze data, develop conclusions, identify risks, and make recommendations.
* Build and maintain a complete site file for each property.
* Maintain and update project files in the CoStar property database.
* Propose real estate integration roadmaps and forecast commonality savings estimates.
* Prepare for Day One post-acquisition activities, including signage and other facility-related objectives.
* Review legal documents and coordinate closing requirements.
* Support post-acquisition projects, prioritizing commonality savings opportunities.
* Collaborate with a network of outsourced service providers.
* Partner with internal teams such as finance, HR, sourcing, marketing, and IT.
* Accurately report financial metrics for cost savings and cost avoidance.
* Participate in continuing education and stay updated on industry trends.
* Lead the development of policies and processes to improve portfolio management.
* Collaborate with Global Brand to maintain facility branding guidelines.
* Support real estate and facility initiatives with Procurement.

**Minimum Requirements/Qualifications:**
----------------------------------------

* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Engineering, or Architecture/Construction Management with equivalent experience.
* Strong financial competence and legal experience in real estate law.
* Excellent communication skills and comfortable interacting with various levels of management.
* Proven record of leading corporate real estate and/or M&A projects.
* Experience with benchmarking and space planning.
* Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills, and proficiency with CoStar.
* Uphold ethical principles and a professional business code of conduct.

**Non-Negotiable Hiring Criteria:**
-----------------------------------

* Independent, analytical, and meticulous with problem-solving abilities.
* Ability to work on international projects.
* Capable of excelling in a fast-paced environment and prioritizing organizational needs.
* Availability for after-hours or weekend work as required.
* 5-10+ years of related experience.
* Experience supporting confidential projects.

title: Wealth Management Data Analyst
description:
**ABOUT US:**  
Come join the dynamic team at Kestra Financial! Kestra Financial provides a leading independent advisor platform that empowers sophisticated, independent financial professionals, including traditional and hybrid RIAs, to prosper, grow, and provide superior client service. With a culture rich in reinvention and advisor advocacy, Kestra Financial has developed integrated business management technology that, combined with its personalized consulting services, offers exceptional scale and efficiency. Kestra Financial supports independent financial advisors in delivering comprehensive securities and investment advisory services to their clients.
  
  
**SUMMARY:**  
As a Data Analyst you will support Kestra’s Wealth Management team by analyzing business metrics, generating insights, and creating reports to drive strategic decision-making. Reporting to the Director of Wealth Management Analytics, this role involves working with various data sources and tools to deliver actionable insights that enhance client services and optimize business processes. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, analytical, and proficient in data analysis tools and technologies.
  
  
**RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

* Collect, clean, shape, and analyze custodian and investment product data for reporting packages
* Develop & maintain dashboards in Tableau to visualize key performance metrics for stakeholders
* Write & optimize SQL / NoSQL queries to extract data from relational and non-relational databases
* Utilize Excel for data manipulation, statistical analysis, and creating pivot tables to support reporting
* Collaborate with broader Data & Analytics organization to support data ETL pipelines
* Assist in the preparation of presentations & reports to communicate insights to senior leadership
* Ensure data accuracy & integrity by performing validation and quality-control checks
* Support ad-hoc data requests and contribute to cross-functional projects as needed

**SKILLS:**  

* Proficiency in Tableau for creating interactive dashboards & data visualizations
* Strong Excel skills including Pivot Tables, XLOOKUP and advanced formulas
* Working knowledge of SQL (for relational databases) and NoSQL (for handling unstructured data)
* Familiarity with Databricks, Snowflake, or other cloud-based platforms for data prep & analytics
* Basic understanding of database technologies and data warehousing concepts
* Ability to interpret complex data and draw meaningful conclusions
* Analytical mindset with strong attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy
* Effective communication skills to present findings to both technical and non-technical audiences
* Ability to work collaboratively and manage multiple tasks under tight deadlines

**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Data Science, Statistics, or related field
* 0-2 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related role (internships and/or academic projects acceptable)
* Hands-on experience with Tableau, Excel, SQL, and/or NoSQL (coursework, internships, or personal projects acceptable)
* Exposure to Databricks, Snowflake, and/or other database technologies is a plus
* Relevant certifications (e.g., Tableau Desktop Specialist, Microsoft Excel, or SQL) are a plus

**INTERNAL APPLICANT POLICY:**  
Internal applicants must be in good standing and have a minimum of 1 year of service with Kestra. Internal applicants must also have a minimum of 1 year service in current role unless approved by EVP.
  
  
**BENEFITS:**  
Full health, vision, dental. 401(k) plans along with a host of voluntary plans such as car insurance, legal services and more (applicable to full-time, permanent employees).
  
DISCLOSURE
  
By applying to a job at Kestra Financial, Inc., you are agreeing to the following statements:
  

* You acknowledge that if hired, Kestra Financial, Inc. may, obtain and use background information concerning your credit, character, general reputation, personal characteristics, work habits, performance and experience for evaluation for your potential employment.
* It is the policy of Kestra Financial to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, identity or expression, age, disability, marital status, citizenship, national origin, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Kestra Financial prohibits any such discrimination or harassment.

**KESTRA VALUES:**  
Our Mission is Powering Financial Independence, enabling the growth and success of investing clients and the advisors who serve them. We do that by living our values: SERVE, MAKE IT HAPPEN, and ONE TEAM.

title: Data Governance Analyst
description:
**ABOUT US:**  
Kestra Holdings offers industry-leading wealth management platforms for independent wealth management professionals nationwide. With an innovative culture that celebrates independence, the company seeks to redefine the future of the advisory industry through superior service, cutting-edge technology, and preeminent resources that every financial professional needs to succeed in the market now and in the years to come.
  
Kestra Holdings companies collectively oversee $123 billion in assets under administration (AUA) and support more than 2,400+ independent financial professionals across the country in delivering comprehensive securities, trust, and investment advisory services to their clients. Located in the “Silicon Hills” of Austin, Texas, Kestra Holdings offers an experience as unique as the city in which it operates.
  
  
Kestra is seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Data Governance Analyst to support the growth and execution of our enterprise data governance framework. This role will work cross-functionally with product owners, stewards, and technical teams to help define and maintain key data standards, policies, definitions, and quality practices across the enterprise.
  
  
As part of the growing Data Governance team, you will assist with monitoring data quality, cataloging critical data elements, and promoting data literacy. This is an excellent opportunity for an analyst with foundational experience in data governance or data management who is eager to contribute to impactful enterprise initiatives in a modern data environment.
  
  
**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:** To perform this job successfully, the individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily:
  

* Support implementation and maintenance of data definitions, metadata standards, and business glossaries using Alation.
* Assist in identifying and documenting critical data elements and their associated business rules.
* Help monitor and triage data quality issues using Monte Carlo and support remediation efforts in coordination with business and technical teams.
* Participate in the development of data quality dashboards and reporting using Tableau.
* Collaborate with data stewards, engineering, and BI teams to map and align data sources with enterprise data models.
* Assist with validation of data across systems during releases and project deployments.
* Contribute to initiatives involving Master Data Management (MDM) and Reference Data Management (RDM) using Profisee; including development and ongoing maintenance.
* Support documentation of data lineage, ownership, and data classifications within the enterprise data catalog.
* Promote awareness of data governance policies and adoption of best practices.
* Coordinate with third party data providers to ensure completeness and accuracy of data feeds.
* Support QA and UAT efforts by influencing and executing real-world data validation scenarios.
* Provide operational support for Governance-managed tools (Alation, Monte Carlo), including managing system integrations, coordinating support tickets, managing costs and licenses, and staying informed about new and upcoming product enhancements.
* Collaborate with Data Engineering to structure and maintain certified datasets as trusted sources.
* Foster a culture of data literacy and best practices throughout the organization.

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND/OR ABILITIES:** To perform this job successfully, individual should have the following skills and abilities:
  
  

* Foundational understanding of data governance principles and the role of data quality in enterprise data strategy.
* Familiarity with metadata management, data catalogs, and business glossary tools (e.g., Alation).
* Exposure to data quality or observability platforms such as Monte Carlo is a plus.
* Working knowledge of SQL for querying and validating data across relational databases.
* Exposure to modern data platforms such as Azure Databricks and Snowflake preferred.
* Ability to analyze and troubleshoot basic data issues and communicate findings clearly.
* Comfortable collaborating with both business users and technical teams.
* Strong organizational and communication skills with attention to detail.
* Ability to communicate technical concepts clearly to non-technical stakeholders.

**SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:** None
  
  
**EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE:**  

* Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Data Analytics, or a related field.
* 2–5 years of experience in data governance, data quality, business analysis, or data management roles.
* Experience working with enterprise data platforms and/or business intelligence tools.
* Experience working on data-related projects, preferably in a regulated industry such as financial services.
* Familiarity with Agile or Scrum project methodologies and tools like Jira or Confluence is a plus.

**CERTIFICATIONS, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS:** None
  
  
**PHYSICAL DEMAND:** The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  
  

* Ability to sit at a computer for long periods of time in office environment well lit.
* Ability to lift up to 20 pounds.
* Position is located in Austin, TX office. Must be able to work in the office during scheduled work hours.

**OTHER DUTIES:** Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a complete comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
  
  
**INTERNAL APPLICANT POLICY:**  
Internal applicants must be in good standing and have a minimum of 1 year of service with Kestra. Internal applicants must also have a minimum of 1 year service in current role unless approved by EVP.
  
  
**BENEFITS:**  
Full health, vision, dental. 401(k) plans along with a host of voluntary plans such as car insurance, legal services and more.
  
DISCLOSURE
  
By applying to a job at Kestra Financial, Inc., you are agreeing to the following statements:
  

* You acknowledge that if hired, Kestra Financial, Inc. may, obtain and use background information concerning your credit, character, general reputation, personal characteristics, work habits, performance and experience for evaluation for your potential employment.
* It is the policy of Kestra Financial to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, identity or expression, age, disability, marital status, citizenship, national origin, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Kestra Financial prohibits any such discrimination or harassment.

**KESTRA VALUES:**  
Our Mission is Powering Financial Independence, enabling the growth and success of investing clients and the advisors who serve them. We do that by living our values: SERVE, MAKE IT HAPPEN, and ONE TEAM.

title: Sr. Data Analyst (Rental)
description:

A Sr Data Analyst leverages proven technical abilities to synthesize complex analytical tasks into easily understood data-driven stories. Responsible for working collaboratively among other talented analysts to apply established and create new analytical processes on diverse datasets to deduce insights and solve real-world business problems. Also ensures that all reporting and analytical responsibilities are completed competently in a timely manner, continually seeks out opportunities to learn new and hone existing technical skills (e.g. writing SQL/code, statistics, machine learning, etc.) and operates under minimal supervision and mentorship of more experienced managers and data scientists.

* Prior direct experience in analyzing the relevant subject matter (e.g. Rental, Merchandising, Operations, Store Experience etc.)
* Experience in MS Excel, MS Access or other analytical tools required.
* Experience with Hadoop, R, SAS or other relevant statistical modeling tools/languages.
* Experience with a variety of statistical modeling and regression analysis techniques and their practical business applications.

**Minimum Education:**

* The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a bachelor's degree program or equivalent degree in a field of study related to the job.

**Preferred Education:**

* 2

title: Technical Intern 2 - Data Analyst
description:
**Job Description**  
See what you're missing. Our employees work on the world's most advanced electronics -from detecting threats for F-15, F-22 & F-35 pilots to illuminating the night for soldiers. Spanning air, land, sea, and space we are developing the technology of tomorrow, delivered today. Drawing strength from our differences, we're innovating for the future. And you can too.  
  
Our flexible work environment provides you a chance to change the world without giving up your personal life. We put our customers first -exemplified by our mission: "We Protect Those Who Protect Us." Sound like a team you want to be a part of? Come build your career with BAE Systems.
  
  
BAE Systems is currently seeking a Technical Intern - Data Analyst for summer 2025. The individual selected for the position will support data and analytics projects for the EW IMC and extended factories on a variety of products and programs. The position will entail working in cross-functional teams to identify and solve data driven problems throughout the business. Activities will include data mining, data processing, dashboard creation, and presentation.  
  
**Required Education, Experience, & Skills**  

* Pursuing a technology or engineering degree
* Effective communication (cross shift, written, PowerPoint, and various levels of audiences)

  
**Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills**  

* Knowledge of data analytics principles
* Microsoft office application proficiency
* Programming experience (DAX, SQL, Microsoft Query)

 **Pay Information**  
Full-Time Salary Range: $44660 - $62088  
  
Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience.  
  
Temporary employees generally are not eligible for BAE Systems benefits, but can elect to participate in the 401(k) savings plan. Temporary employees working 20+ hours per week are eligible for medical benefits, the employee assistance program, and business travel accident insurance.  
  
**About BAE Systems Electronic Systems**  
BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it’s what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference. Electronic Systems (ES) is the global innovator behind BAE Systems’ game-changing defense and commercial electronics. Exploiting every electron, we push the limits of what is possible, giving our customers the edge and our employees opportunities to change the world. Our products and capabilities can be found everywhere – from the depths of the ocean to the far reaches of space. At our core are more than 14,000 highly talented Electronic Systems employees with the brightest minds in the industry, we make an impact – for our customers and the communities we serve.  
  
This position will be posted for at least 5 calendar days. The posting will remain active until the position is filled, or a qualified pool of candidates is identified.
company_description: BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company. Meaningful. Empowering. Remarkable. That’s a career at BAE Systems.

title: Analyst, Production Management
description:
At CVS Health, we’re building a world of health around every consumer and surrounding ourselves with dedicated colleagues who are passionate about transforming health care.

As the nation’s leading health solutions company, we reach millions of Americans through our local presence, digital channels and more than 300,000 purpose-driven colleagues – caring for people where, when and how they choose in a way that is uniquely more connected, more convenient and more compassionate. And we do it all with heart, each and every day.

This position supports the Production team in meeting our regional or client goals. They are primarily responsible for the ongoing analysis, tracking of KPIs, and interpretation of data that is crucial to maintaining and exceeding our production goals, quality, and ensuring all KPIs are on track for achieving objectives through the most efficient use of resources. This individual will work closely with all Production team members across clients and regions. The position will use data to determine strengths and opportunities for improvement in operations. The position will develop and effectively communicate suggestions at client and regional levels so the Production Team can make informed decisions.

Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities  

* Research, track, and monitor client or regional commitments, goals, and expectations
* Collect data from numerous sources, clean data, and analyze data to identify trends
* Use data and analysis to predict issues before they arise
* Provide team with actionable insights and analysis reports based on data to support decision-making efforts
* Monitor performance KPIs
* Respond promptly to inquiries

  
Education  
High school diploma or equivalent  
Bachelor's degree preferred  
  
Experience  
0 to 2 years of prior relevant experience  
Experience in resource or capacity management  
  
Essential Qualifications  

* Ability to recognize, evaluate and solve complex problems
* Adept with technology and advanced skills in tools for analysis, particularly PowerBI and MS Excel MS
* Proven ability to evaluate and provide recommendations for solving complex problems, especially using data visualization
* Proven ability to execute against cross functional and operational initiatives or multiple projects simultaneously
* Experience in a large, complex and healthcare / healthcare technology organization
* Proven project management expertise
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Fluently speak, read, and write English
* Understanding of key metrics and best practices for reporting / metric development
* Proven ability to prioritize with a team and advocate for priorities with other teams
* Reputation of doing what it takes to get the job done while ensuring strong interpersonal relationships; puts the interests of the organization ahead of personal interests
* Ability to balance strong business capabilities and high business ethics with a commitment to clinical and service excellence
* Ability to express and implement concepts and ideas, both orally and in writing
* Demonstrates competency in technology applications related to business and clinical functions and in process improvement methodologies.

**Anticipated Weekly Hours**

40

**Time Type**

Full time

**Pay Range**

The typical pay range for this role is:

$21.10 - $40.90

This pay range represents the base hourly rate or base annual full-time salary for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual base salary offer will depend on a variety of factors including experience, education, geography and other relevant factors. This position is eligible for a CVS Health bonus, commission or short-term incentive program in addition to the base pay range listed above.

Our people fuel our future. Our teams reflect the customers, patients, members and communities we serve and we are committed to fostering a workplace where every colleague feels valued and that they belong.

**Great benefits for great people**

We take pride in our comprehensive and competitive mix of pay and benefits – investing in the physical, emotional and financial wellness of our colleagues and their families to help them be the healthiest they can be. In addition to our competitive wages, our great benefits include:

* **Affordable medical plan options,** a **401(k) plan** (including matching company contributions), and an **employee stock purchase plan**.
* **No-cost programs for all colleagues** including wellness screenings, tobacco cessation and weight management programs, confidential counseling and financial coaching.
* **Benefit solutions that address the different needs and preferences of our colleagues** including paid time off, flexible work schedules, family leave, dependent care resources, colleague assistance programs, tuition assistance, retiree medical access and many other benefits depending on eligibility.

For more information, visit https://jobs.cvshealth.com/us/en/benefits

We anticipate the application window for this opening will close on: 06/24/2025

Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with all federal, state and local laws.
