title: Financial Analyst (Finance)
description:
**Organization Overview:** The Goddard Riverside Community Center (Goddard Riverside) and the Stanley M. Isaacs Neighborhood Center (Isaacs Center) are well-established Manhattan community-based agencies that support services to approximately 30,000 New Yorkers. We are two of New York City’s leading human services organizations meeting the needs of children, youth and families, homeless individuals, and older adults throughout Manhattan and New York City. We work every day for a fair and just society where all people have the opportunity to make choices that lead to better lives for themselves and their families.

**Position Summary:** The Financial Analyst will create, produce, maintain, and interpret financial analyses to support key decision-making across finance areas including contract funding, budgeting, annual audit, vendors, and general accounting. The Financial Analyst will be lead support for budget software installation, training and roll-out to programs.

**Schedule:** Monday - Friday (9:00am to 5:00pm)

**Salary Range:** $70,000 - $80,000

***Candidates must have the required qualifications to be considered for the position. The s******alary offer will be based on the candidate’s number of years experience in the exact or comparable position and additional preferred qualifications will be taken into account.***

**Roles, Responsibilities and Essential Duties**

* Support Financial Reporting Manager in annual budget process including as system lead expert for new software installation, training and roll-out. Be part of the training team for Budget system, new staff and enhancements.
* Develop, update and maintain multiple methods of allocations for organization-wide shared costs
* Assist Payroll Manager in biweekly payroll and fringe-related postings, including reconciliations to Paycom and Accounts Payable amounts
* Develop and analyze custom financial analysis from large data sets for funder, program and summary reporting as needed
* Assist Program Accountants and Program staff in budgeting and forecasting
* Prepare presentations for managers and participate in budget meetings and trainings
* Assist in year-end close. Provide support for annual Audit including data verification and preparation of support schedules
* Monitor and test financial data to ensure data integrity and accuracy
* Develop ad-hoc reporting for key business initiatives, as requested

**Qualifications/Educational Requirements**

* Bachelor’s Degree required, major in Accounting/Finance preferred
* Advanced Excel skills, especially handling large data sets for summary reporting
* Minimum of 4 years of professional experience in related field
* Knowledge of accounting and financial reporting
* Knowledge of grant processing including federal, state and local government laws and regulations regarding grant administration including the Uniform Guidance
* Working knowledge of government contracts.

**Other Abilities**

* Superior attention to detail and the ability to analyze data and then communicate the results in a concise manner
* Ability to effectively handle multiple projects concurrently
* Ability to work extended hours during close, audit periods and other critical times
* Ability to work with interruptions and tight deadlines
* Ability to work independently and to be self-reliant while still working effectively in a team environment
* Ability to prioritize and take ownership of work
* Ability to work collaboratively with internal and external customers
* Ability to maintain confidentiality of company information

**Computer Skills: To perform this job successfully, an individual should have/be:**

* Working knowledge of Intacct and budgeting software platforms (experience with Vena Solutions a plus)
* Proficient in Microsoft Office with advanced Excel skills
* Prior experience with NYC PASSPort (or other government portals) a plus

**Language Skills**

* Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations.
* Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public

**Reasoning Ability**

* Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions

**Physical Requirements**

* Heavy computer use

**Work Environment**

* Partially remote with weekly in-person at our NYC offices

**Employee Benefits:**

* Medical/Dental/Vision
* Life Insurance/Commuter benefits/Employee Assistance Program (EAP)/Flexible Spending Accounts

* 403B Thrift Retirement Plan
* 12 Annual Sick Days
* 12 Agency Holidays
* 20 Days or 4 Weeks of Paid Time off and an additional week (5) days after 5 years of employment
* Total of more than 6 weeks (a month and half) of paid time off

***We are committed to building an inclusive workplace community grounded in respect for differences. We support hiring a broadly diverse team of qualified individuals who will contribute to our organizations.***

***Goddard Riverside and Isaacs Center provide equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.***

***The intent of this job description is to provide a representative summary of duties and responsibilities that will be required of this position and title and shall not be construed as a declaration of the specific duties and responsibilities of any particular position. Employees may be requested to perform job related task other than those specifically presented in this description. This job description does not constitute an employment agreement between the employer and employee and is subject to change by the employer. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.***

title: Fleet Solutions Analyst - Tire Intelligence
description:
Requisition ID: 125426  
Sponsorship Available: No  
Relocation Assistance Available: No

**Goodyear. More Driven.**

**Primary Purpose**

Goodyear Tire Intelligence Solutions (GTIS) is the company's global tire intelligence technologies. With GTIS, data from a variety of on-vehicle sensors is sent to Goodyear’s mobility cloud in real time, where its unique, customizable algorithms indicate tire health, deliver performance insights over time and detect potential issues so operators can seek proactive maintenance.

Goodyear Tire Intelligence Solutions (GTIS) includes a suite of products that work within the platform to enable seamless, safe and reliable movement for drivers, vehicles, operators, municipalities, original equipment manufacturers, and suppliers in order to make life’s connections easier.

The Fleet Solutions Analyst - Tire Intelligence will be responsible for supporting the Senior Application Engineer - Tire Intelligence and working with the Engineering team in the development, testing, documentation creation, training tool development, validation, and deployment of tire intelligence applications plus hardware systems.

The incumbent will develop the proposed solutions and work through the industrialization process to ensure they are ready for real-world application. The position involves hands-on work with vehicle systems, troubleshooting, document creation, and interfacing with business units to ensure the seamless integration of new technologies.

* One must be willing to travel up to 15% - 30%

**Primary Responsibilities**

  

* Conduct troubleshooting activities and diagnostic tests related to performance, durability, and safety of automotive components/tire intelligence applications
* Utilize analytical and problem solving skills to address mechanical challenges in a professional manner - Assist in the creation of technical documents and installation training tools
* Work closely with Engineering team resources to develop positive knowledge transfer relationships
* Maintain a continuous process improvement mentality and effectively communicate feedback to respective personnel
* Assist Engineers in the design, development, and testing of automotive systems/components
* Collaborate with the Senior Application Engineer - Tire Intelligence and utilize a general understanding of automotive related processes/standards
* Display a commitment to Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) standards and maintain a professional image/work environment
* Perform support roles in technology training
* Support/assist with the creation of global standard installation manuals for wiring harnesses, brackets, and electronic modules
* Create quality documentation on any test results and provide detailed reports on system performance - Collect, decipher, and analyze data to make informed decisions
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure project goals are met
* Operate as an ambassador of the GTIS department to internal and external entities
* Effectively coach and train others
* Maintain a train-the-trainer mentality to always be prepared to invest knowledge into internal and external customers

**Required Education and Experience**

  

* Bachelor's degree, or in lieu of degree, 5+ years of project management experience, including drafting technical documents
* Previous project management experience, including drafting technical documents
* Experience working with commercial vehicles in a fleet environment
* Proven experience as an Engineering Technician, preferably in the automotive industry
* Experience in cross-functional assignments or projects
* Ability to interpret and modify electrical schematics and wiring harnesses

**Desired Knowledge and Skills**

  

* Excellent written and verbal communication skills to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
* Continuous learning mentality as evidenced by application of knowledge, gained through additional education, experience, or training
* Strong technical and mechanical skills
* Proficiency in using diagnostic and testing equipment
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities
* Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
* Ability to travel up to 15% - 30%

Goodyear is one of the world's largest tire companies. It employs about 71,000 people and manufactures its products in 55 facilities in 22 countries around the world. Its two Innovation Centers in Akron, Ohio, and Colmar-Berg, Luxembourg, strive to develop state-of-the-art products and services that set the technology and performance standard for the industry. For more information about Goodyear and its products, go to www.goodyear.com/corporate

Goodyear is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to that individual's race, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, veteran status, genetic information, ethnicity, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by law.

If you need reasonable accommodation to complete the online application, or any other part of the employment process, please contact the Goodyear Candidate Care Line at 330.796.4500.

Click here for more information about Equal Employment Opportunity laws, and here for additional supplementary information.

title: IT Analyst
description:
Kaukahi, LLC is seeking an experienced IT Analyst to join our growing team at Fort Johnson, LA. The successful candidate will support Army Real Property and Installation Geospatial Information & Services (IGI&S) operations. This role requires deep familiarity with the Department of Defense and Army geospatial policy implementation, authoritative data sources, enterprise geospatial systems, and Esri’s ArcGIS suite.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*(Duties may include, but are not limited to:)*

* Provide on-site geospatial program management and coordination, including support to analysts and technicians.
* Lead and coordinate multiple geospatial and IT-related projects concurrently.
* Administer, analyze, and troubleshoot issues related to GIS database applications and end-user systems.
* Conduct operational verification tests and quality control checks on IT systems.
* Identify, analyze, and resolve system anomalies affecting GIS/IT operations.
* Ensure compliance with DCS G-9 IGI&S Quality Assurance Plans (QAPs), including the Common Installation Picture (CIP).
* Apply the most recent version of the Spatial Data Standard for Facilities, Infrastructure, and Environment (SDSFIE) Army Adaptation.
* Utilize and support the Esri ArcGIS platform, including enterprise-level applications.
* Understand and work with data formats and systems such as ePRISMS, GFEBS, HQIIS, ASIP, and RPLANS.

Compensation Minimum: $95,000.00

Compensation Maximum: $105,000.00

Job Requirements:

**Required Qualifications:**

* U.S. citizenship is required.
* Ability to obtain and maintain a secret clearance.
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, GIS, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
* 5+ years of experience as an IT Analyst, GIS Analyst, or in a related technical role.
* Experience supporting the Department of Defense or U.S. government entities is preferred.
* Strong organizational, analytical, and communication skills.
* Proficiency with enterprise GIS systems and Esri ArcGIS software suite.

**Work Location:** Fort Johnson, LA

**Physical Requirements**

*Work may involve sitting or standing for extended periods of time. Position may require typing and reading from a computer screen. Must have sufficient mobility, including but not limited to bending, reaching, and kneeling to complete daily duties in a timely and efficient manner. May include lifting weight up to {50} pounds as necessary*. *Optional:* *Physically able to walk or stand for more than 6 hours per day*

*Kaukahi reserves the right to change or modify job duties and assignments at any time. The above job description is not all encompassing. Positions functions and qualifications may vary depending on business needs.*

*Kaukahi is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against applicants based on race, color, creed, religion, medical condition, legally protected genetic information, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition), sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, or Vietnam era, or other eligible veteran status or legally.*

***Salary Range:*** *$95,000.00 - $105,000.00*

title: Business Analyst l
description:
**Description**

* Applies skills and knowledge obtained while in the Associate Business Analyst role, or through equivalent experience, by performing business operations analysis (how works gets done within a functional group) and reporting and analysis that is typically function-specific (e.g., claims, distribution, underwriting, marketing, finance, accounting, etc.).
* Performs research, analyzes information, presents findings, and assists in recommending changes and/or taking action based on various factors (e.g., data insights, regulatory changes, finance or accounting booking, policy or claim information, etc.) to solve problems and improve business outcomes’
* Seeks advice from managers and/or more experienced staff to guide further professional growth.
* At least 75% of time is spent on a combination of the following responsibilities:
* Performs research by gathering data from a variety of sources, which may include operational data, metrics, financial information for booking revenue and expense, and feedback from business partners.
* Analyzes information to identify trends, patterns, gaps and insights using descriptive analytics.
* Assists in building the business case for making a change to current practices, programs or procedures.
* Conducts current state assessment, opportunity assessment, cost/benefit analysis, feasibility assessment, etc.
* Supports implementation of business process improvements and development
* May own implementation and evaluation of smaller scale changes.
* Owns report development for reports considered of lower-level complexity. Recommends changes to, makes modifications, prepares, and distributes standard and ad hoc reports/dashboards.
* Assists in developing presentations and shares findings as well as recommendations.
* Receives, evaluates and responds to data-related inquiries by applying knowledge of data and business operations and obtaining information from various sources.

**Qualifications**

* Demonstrated research, problem solving, analytical, critical thinking, and relationship management skills.
* Business operations knowledge to include understanding the function's value chain and awareness of market conditions.
* Solid knowledge of Excel.
* Developing knowledge of available data sources, strengths and shortcomings.
* Knowledge of database software preferred.
* Competencies typically acquired through a Bachelor s degree or equivalent experience in addition to 6-9 months of relevant experience.

**About Us**

**Pay Philosophy:** The typical starting salary range for this role is determined by a number of factors including skills, experience, education, certifications and location. The full salary range for this role reflects the competitive labor market value for all employees in these positions across the national market and provides an opportunity to progress as employees grow and develop within the role. Some roles at Liberty Mutual have a corresponding compensation plan which may include commission and/or bonus earnings at rates that vary based on multiple factors set forth in the compensation plan for the role.  
  
As a purpose-driven organization, Liberty Mutual is committed to fostering an environment where employees from all backgrounds can build long and meaningful careers. Through strong relationships, comprehensive benefits and continuous learning opportunities, we seek to create an environment where employees can succeed, both professionally and personally.  
  
At Liberty Mutual, we believe progress happens when people feel secure. By providing protection for the unexpected and delivering it with care, we help people embrace today and confidently pursue tomorrow.  
  
We are dedicated to fostering an inclusive environment where employees from all backgrounds can build long and meaningful careers. By actively seeking employee feedback and amplifying the voices of our seven Employee Resource Groups (ERGs), which are open to all, we create an environment where every individual can make a meaningful impact so we continue to meet the evolving needs of our customers.  
  
We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to make things better, and we put people first by offering you benefits that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits  
  
Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We will not tolerate discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran's status, pregnancy, genetic information or on any basis prohibited by federal, state or local law.  
  
**Fair Chance Notices**

* California
* Los Angeles Incorporated
* Los Angeles Unincorporated
* Philadelphia
* San Francisco

title: Fixed Income Data Science Analyst
description:
**Company Description**

Tradeweb Markets is a world leader in the evolution of electronic trading. A fintech company serving approximately 2,500 clients – including the world’s largest banks, asset managers, hedge funds, insurance companies, wealth managers and retail clients - in more than 65 countries across the globe. Since our first trade in 1998, we have helped transform and electronify the fixed income markets. Tradeweb is a culture built on innovation, creativity and collaboration. Through a combination of very talented and driven people, innovative products and solutions, cutting-edge technology, market data, and a vast network of clients, we continue to work together to improve the way financial markets trade.

Mission: Move first and never stop. Collaborate with clients to create and build solutions that drive efficiency, connectivity, and transparency in electronic trading.

Tradeweb Markets LLC ("Tradeweb") is proud to be an EEO Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled/Affirmative Action Employer.

**Group Details**

This position is responsible for delivering and maintaining high-impact, data-driven insights, recommendations and metrics around trading activity and trends for the Institutional US Rates platform. An ideal candidate will be a natural problem solver, strategic thinker with intellectual curiosity, results driven and possess a strong interest in finance and data analytics

**Job Responsibilities**

* Utilize Python /Tableau /SQL/VBA to create useful, visually appealing dashboards for internal and external use
* Build and test models to predict market trends such as trade cost and pricing based on publicly available and proprietary data, using traditional methods as well as ML when appropriate
* Partner with sales, product and senior management teams to create and maintain effective and compelling analysis and reports
* Develop working relationships across multiple internal departments to effectively collate and analyze data
* Understand legacy reporting infrastructures and adjust accordingly to align with data governance, compliance, marketing and business needs
* Identify external data requests that need to be streamlined to allow for more efficient ways to provide approved data to clients.
* Analysis of trading and market data to identify trends and patterns in market/customer behavior, generate recommendations to optimize across different dimensions
* Find ways to create revenue generating data products beyond standard reporting

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance or any equivalent analytic field of study or equivalent work experience
* 5+ years experience
* Ability to work cooperatively and collaboratively with all levels of employees, management, and other members of the business
* Ability to work well with others in a team-oriented environment
* Excellent written and oral communication skills
* Ability to work under pressure and able to handle multiple tasks with efficiency on a daily basis
* Proven analytical skills; ability to create reports and model data
* Fluency in Tableau and other data visualization software is required
* Expert Excel knowledge is required
* SQL experience is required
* Python experience is required
* Experience and understanding for Rates and Fixed Income Markets is a plus

**Additional Information**

Tradeweb is committed to providing valuable and competitive benefits. In addition to working in our culture of innovation and collaboration, we offer:

* **Health Insurance** : Highly competitive medical, dental, and vision programs
* **Hybrid Environment** : Our employees have the flexibility of working in the office and from home.
* **Health Care and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts** : You may elect to set aside pre-tax earnings to pay for eligible health care and dependent day care expenses for you and your eligible family members.
* **Maven Family Building Benefit** : Maven offers support for fertility and preconception; pregnancy and post-partum; adoption; surrogacy and pediatrics for children up to age 10. Tradeweb provide a $10,000 lifetime reimbursement towards fertility, egg freezing, adoption and surrogacy expenses.
* **Building Wealth - 401(k) Savings Plan** : Employees are immediately eligible for the 401(k) plan. Participants may contribute up to 75% of eligible compensation into a traditional 401(k) and/or Roth 401(k). Tradeweb will match 100% of the first 4% of compensation that you contribute.
* The current pay range for this role if performed in the city of New York is currently $100,000 to $250,000 per year, based on a regular, full-time schedule. The amount of pay offered will be determined by a number of factors, including but not limited to qualifications, market data, geographic location, and internal guidelines.

**Other Benefit Programs**

* Pre-Tax Commuter Benefits Program
* ARAG Legal Services
* Employee Assistance Program
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Financial Wellness Tools
* Travel Assistance Benefits
* Pet Insurance
* Corporate Gym Subsidies
* Wellness Perks
* Paid Time Off and Parental Leave

title: PS Finance Sr Business Analyst
description:
**Posting Number**

STA00458PO25

  

**Job Family**

Information Technology

  

**Job Function**

IT Business Systems Analysis

  

**USC Market Title**

IT Business Analyst

  

**Link to USC Market Title**

https://uscjobs.sc.edu/titles/133277

  

**Job Level**

P4 - Professional

  

**Business Title (Internal Title)**

PS Finance Sr Business Analyst

  

**Campus**

Columbia

  

**Work County**

Richland

  

**College/Division**

Division of Information Technology

  

**Department**

IT Enterprise Applications

  

**State Pay Band**

9

  

**Approved Starting Salary**

$95,954

  

**Advertised Salary Range**

$95,954-$143,931

  

**Location of Vacancy**

  

**Part/Full Time**

Full Time

  

**Hours per Week**

37.5

  

**Work Schedule**

***Standard working schedule: 8:30am – 5:00pm***

***Must be willing to work a flexible schedule to meet the needs of the department.***

  

**Basis**

12 months

  

**Job Search Category**

Information Technology

About USC

**About University of South Carolina**

From the Upstate to the Lowcountry, the University of South Carolina system is transforming the lives of South Carolinians through the impact of our eight institutions and 20 locations throughout the state. More than 50,000 students are enrolled at one of eight institutions, including the research campus in Columbia and comprehensive four-year universities in Aiken, Upstate and Beaufort. In addition, our Palmetto College campuses in Salkehatchie, Union, Lancaster and Sumter enable students to earn associate or bachelor’s degrees through a combination of in-person, online or blended learning. All of our system institutions place strong emphasis on service — helping to build healthier, more educated communities in South Carolina and beyond.

Benefits for FTE Positions

The University of South Carolina (USC), through the State of SC and Public Employee Benefit Authority (PEBA), offers employees a valuable benefits package, including health and life insurance, generous paid leave and retirement programs. To learn more about USC benefits, access the "Working at USC" section on the Applicant Portal at https://uscjobs.sc.edu. Research Grant or Time-limited positions may be eligible for all, some, or no benefits, based on the grant or project funding.

Position Description

**Advertised Job Summary**

**Sr PeopleSoft Finance Business Analyst**

* Are you looking for an opportunity to work as an IT professional in the ever-evolving world of higher education?
* Does the prospect of designing and implementing customer-centric IT solutions in concert with strategic goals and initiatives excite you?
* Are you seeking opportunities to leverage your experience with proven enterprise applications to improve and expand the operational efficiencies of a complex organization?
* Are you a PeopleSoft professional looking for a new challenge in a positive and rewarding workplace?
  

* **So, what’s day-to-day?**

**You will:**

* Work on modern enterprise application solutions.
* Work with a dynamic team of IT Business Analysts.
* Design quality solutions using proven modern technologies.
* Participate in and lead important strategic projects and activities.
* Continually improve and expand technical and business skills in the service of university stakeholders and customers.

“An ideal candidate for this job will have 5 or more years of experience in a business analyst role supporting Accounts Payable, Expenses, and Treasury modules within PeopleSoft FSCM v9.2 and exhibit strong SQL skills and knowledge of application configurations, transaction processing, and underlying data relationships.”  
  
**Perks**

* **Downtown Location:** Enjoy working in the heart of Columbia, SC, with easy access to vibrant city life, dining, and cultural events.
* **Energetic Leadership:** Thrive under the guidance of an energetic and innovative leadership team dedicated to transforming IT at USC, making your role impactful and exciting.
* **Incredible Benefits You Will Not Find Elsewhere:** Over 30 paid days off, paid tuition, state benefits, state retirement, and more!
* **Professional Development:** We take investing back in you seriously! We offer generous professional development opportunities throughout each year.
* **Love Where You Work:** You can take incredible pride in working for South Carolina’s flagship university.
* **The Best Part:** Oh, and did we mention we have an AWESOME Team?

*If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, apply today*!

  

**Job Related Minimum Required Education and Experience**

Requires a bachelor’s degree in a job related field and 4 or more years of job related experience, which may be substituted by an equivalent combination of job related certification, training, education, and/or experience.

  

**Required Certification, Licensure/Other Credentials**

  

**Preferred Qualifications**

Prefer at least 5 years business analyst experience. Preferred related areas include, but are not limited to Accounting, Finance, Business, Purchasing, or Information Technology. PeopleSoft Financials 9.x or higher application support experience. Experience creating PeopleSoft Queries and nVision reports. Phire release management application support experience preferred, but not required.

  

**Knowledge/Skills/Abilities**

Extensive knowledge of capabilities, techniques, and intricacies of enterprise resource planning (ERP) information systems – including deep knowledge of at least one of the following area: General Ledger, Purchasing, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Contracts, Grants Management, Projects, or Banking. Ability to understand and carry out complex technical analysis, instructions and requests. Ability to communicate in a clear and concise manner – including creating and giving presentations. Ability to work effectively with users, vendors, and IT personnel. Ability to identify and resolve problems. Ability to plan, direct, instruct, and review the work of technical personnel. Ability to lead complex technical projects. Extensive knowledge of technical documentation. Working knowledge of information system software, internet software, spreadsheet software and word processing software as well as basic PC applications and operations – including Word, Excel and other MS Office products. Project management skills. Occasional work at other than normal times may be required based on production support responsibilities and other duties as assigned from time-to-time. Identification of and adherence to IT best practices and standard operating procedures for program management are important; however, flexibility in meeting the needs of customers is also a key consideration.

Job Duties

**Job Duty**

Provide FSCM production incident triage/resolution as well as problem analysis/resolution support (tier 2) for assigned modules. title: Data Analyst L2
description:

**Job Summary**

Galapagos Federal Systems LLC is looking for an enthusiastic, well-qualified individual to fill the Data Analyst L2 position. This position offers a unique opportunity to contribute to a high-performing team dedicated to advancing space capabilities in support of national defense.

We are looking for a candidate with proven technical expertise to provide meaningful, actionable data analytics from a variety of data sources and systems to support Space Training and Readiness Command leadership decisions and enterprise policy creation and reporting.

Compensation Minimum: $130,000

Compensation Maximum: $142,000

Job Requirements:

**Skills / Experience Required**

**Data Analyst L2 Skills and Experience:**

* Active Top Secret/SCI clearance
* 5+ years of practical expertise and relevant Department of Defense (DoD) experience
* Demonstrated experience analyzing complex data from dashboards, business processes, pilot activities, and other activities to extract actionable insights
* Expertise in preparing and presenting understandable results of data analytics that drive stakeholders’ decisions on programs and processes
* Collected, gathered, and prepared large datasets from various sources, including cleaning and standardizing data for analysis, and creating compelling data visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders
* Created visualization reports using Microsoft Power Apps

Work may involve sitting or standing for extended periods of time and typing and reading from a computer screen. title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
**About the Team**

With more choices at the fingertips of consumers than ever before, Fanatics is building the leading global digital sports platform to create interactive, lasting fan experiences which also helps partners establish better direct-to-consumer relationships in today’s highly competitive world.

  

Fanatics Collectibles has the combined vision and distinct strengths of both Fanatics and Topps that will improve the collector experience while maintaining vital parts of the hobby. Fanatics’ data-driven, direct-to-consumer expertise, which includes a database of more than 80 million sports fans globally, will enhance and expand Topps’ existing digital capabilities and grow the market opportunity for all participants. In addition, Topps’ world-class quality, product development, and manufacturing capabilities, along with their commitment to collectors and hobby shops, will ensure products are more readily accessible, positively impacting current and future collectors and partners.

**Role Overview:**  
As a Senior Data Analyst, you will be instrumental in shaping our strategic decisions and operational efficiencies. You will work closely with cross-functional teams—including strategy, business operations, and physical operations to drive the business forward by delivering actionable insights, clear storytelling using data, and crafting compelling data visualizations. Your expertise in SQL, Python/R, and other data and analytics tools will drive key insights that inform both long-term strategic planning and day-to-day improvements.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Data Analysis & Reporting:**
  + Extract, manipulate, and analyze large datasets using SQL and advanced analytics techniques.
  + Develop automated reporting solutions and dashboards that provide business insights.
* **Advanced Analytics & Modeling:**
  + Build and validate predictive models using Python or R to forecast business trends and operational challenges.
  + Develop sophisticated data models that capture the nuances of our business operations and performance.
* **Data Visualization:**
  + Design and maintain highly polished and dynamic dashboards and visualizations that communicate data findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* **Stakeholder Management:**
  + Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into actionable analytics projects.
  + Present insights and recommendations to executive leadership and other key stakeholders.
* **Strategic & Operational Support:**
  + Partner with strategy and business operations teams to develop data-driven strategies that optimize performance and drive growth.
  + Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and identify areas for improvements.
* **Process Improvement & Innovation:**
  + Continuously identify opportunities to enhance data processes and methodologies.
  + Act as a thought leader in data analytics, contributing to the overall data strategy of the company.

**Required Qualifications:**

**Education:**

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Data Science, or a related field.

  

**Experience:**

* 4+ years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, or data science roles.
* Demonstrable experience in the technology industry or at a startup is a plus.

  

**Technical Proficiency:**

* Expert-level SQL skills.
* Proven experience with data warehousing in Snowflake, data transformation with dbt, and data visualization (e.g. Sigma Computing, Tableau, or Looker)
* Proficiency in advanced analytics.
* Strong coding skills in Python or R.

  

**Soft Skills:**

* Strong analytical, problem-solving, and strategic thinking skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with a proven ability to collaborate across departments.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience working in tech startups or other dynamic technology companies.
* Familiarity with cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure).
* Experience with growth analytics, marketing analytics and MarTech tools.

  

*In NYC, the salary range for this position is $144,000 - $180,000, which represents base pay only and does not include short-term or long-term incentive compensation. In Los Angeles, the salary range for this position is $132,000 - $165,000. The listed salary ranges are specific to Los Angeles or NYC and may not be applicable to other locations. When determining base pay, as part of a final compensation package, we consider several factors such as location, experience, qualifications, and training.*

  

*Ensure your Fanatics job offer is legitimate and don’t fall victim to fraud. Fanatics never seeks payment from job applicants. Feel free to ask your recruiter for a phone call or other type of communication for interview, and ensure your communication is coming from a Fanatics email address (including @collectfanatics.com). For added security, where possible, apply through our company website at* *www.fanaticsinc.com/careers*

Fanatics Collectibles is a new model and vision for the hobby, fundamentally changing the experience for current and future collectors, leagues, and players across many U.S. and international professional and college sports. The organization has long-term, exclusive rights to design, manufacture and distribute trading cards for several sports and entertainment properties, including MLB, MLBPA, the Premier League, MLS, UFC, Formula 1 as well as Disney, Marvel, Pixar, and Star Wars, among others. In January 2022, Fanatics Collectibles announced the acquisition of Topps, establishing the preeminent licensed trading card brand as the cornerstone of Fanatics’ trading cards and collectibles business, and jumpstarted its MLB and MLBPA rights to design, manufacture and distribute trading cards

Fanatics is building a leading global digital sports platform. We ignite the passions of global sports fans and maximize the presence and reach for our hundreds of sports partners globally by offering products and services across Fanatics Commerce, Fanatics Collectibles, and Fanatics Betting & Gaming, allowing sports fans to Buy, Collect, and Bet. Through the Fanatics platform, sports fans can buy licensed fan gear, jerseys, lifestyle and streetwear products, headwear, and hardgoods; collect physical and digital trading cards, sports memorabilia, and other digital assets; and bet as the company builds its Sportsbook and iGaming platform. Fanatics has an established database of over 100 million global sports fans; a global partner network with approximately 900 sports properties, including major national and international professional sports leagues, players associations, teams, colleges, college conferences and retail partners, 2,500 athletes and celebrities, and 200 exclusive athletes; and over 2,000 retail locations, including its Lids retail stores. Our more than 22,000 employees are committed to relentlessly enhancing the fan experience and delighting sports fans globally.

title: Senior Product Data Analyst
description:
**About the Role**

As a Senior Product Data Analyst, you will play a critical role in shaping our product strategy by analyzing user behavior, identifying trends, measuring A/B test results, and driving actionable insights. You’ll collaborate closely with product managers, engineers, and business stakeholders to drive fuel growth. If you're passionate about data, love solving complex problems, and thrive in a fast-paced environment, we’d love to hear from you!

  

**Responsibilities**

* Partner with product teams to define KPIs, track performance, and uncover insights that drive product decisions.
* Conduct deep-dive analyses on user behavior, feature adoption, and conversion funnels to improve engagement and retention.
* Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to empower teams with real-time data.
* Design and analyze A/B tests to optimize product features and user experience.
* Leverage SQL, Python, or R to extract, clean, and analyze large datasets.
* Work cross-functionally with engineering and business teams to identify growth opportunities and improve user experience.
* Present data-driven recommendations to leadership and stakeholders in a clear, actionable manner.
* Contribute to building a strong data culture by advocating best practices and improving data literacy across the company.

  

**Skills & Qualifications**

* 4+ years of experience in product analytics, data science, or a related field.
* Strong proficiency in SQL (experience with Snowflake, or Redshift is a plus).
* Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Sigma, Tableau, Looker).
* Proficiency in Python or R for data analysis and statistical modeling.
* Strong understanding of A/B testing, statistical analysis, and experimentation frameworks.
* Experience working with event-based data tracking tools (e.g., Amplitude, Mixpanel, Google Analytics).
* Ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and a growth mindset.
* Experience in a fast-paced startup environment is a plus.

  

*In Los Angeles, the salary range for this position is $132,000-$165,000, which represents base pay only and does not include short-term or long-term incentive compensation. In NYC, the salary range for this position is $144,000-$180,000. The listed salary ranges are specific to Los Angeles or NYC and may not be applicable to other locations. When determining base pay, as part of a final compensation package, we consider several factors such as location, experience, qualifications, and training.*

  

*Ensure your Fanatics job offer is legitimate and don’t fall victim to fraud. Fanatics never seeks payment from job applicants. Feel free to ask your recruiter for a phone call or other type of communication for interview, and ensure your communication is coming from a Fanatics email address (including @**collectfanatics.com**). For added security, where possible, apply through our company website at* *www.fanaticsinc.com/careers**.*

The organization has long-term, exclusive rights to design, manufacture and distribute trading cards for several sports and entertainment properties, including MLB, MLBPA, the Premier League, MLS, UFC, Formula 1 as well as Disney, Marvel, Pixar, and Star Wars, among others. In January 2022, Fanatics Collectibles announced the acquisition of Topps, establishing the preeminent licensed trading card brand as the cornerstone of Fanatics’ trading cards and collectibles business, and jumpstarted its MLB and MLBPA rights to design, manufacture and distribute trading cards

Fanatics is building a leading global digital sports platform. We ignite the passions of global sports fans and maximize the presence and reach for our hundreds of sports partners globally by offering products and services across Fanatics Commerce, Fanatics Collectibles, and Fanatics Betting & Gaming, allowing sports fans to Buy, Collect, and Bet. Through the Fanatics platform, sports fans can buy licensed fan gear, jerseys, lifestyle and streetwear products, headwear, and hardgoods; collect physical and digital trading cards, sports memorabilia, and other digital assets; and bet as the company builds its Sportsbook and iGaming platform. Fanatics has an established database of over 100 million global sports fans; a global partner network with approximately 900 sports properties, including major national and international professional sports leagues, players associations, teams, colleges, college conferences and retail partners, 2,500 athletes and celebrities, and 200 exclusive athletes; and over 2,000 retail locations, including its Lids retail stores. Our more than 22,000 employees are committed to relentlessly enhancing the fan experience and delighting sports fans globally.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Posting Details

**Classification Title**

Full Time Monthly Staff

  

**Posting Number**

FY17/18477SF

  

**Position Status**

Full-time

  

**FLSA**

Exempt

  

**Salary and Benefits**

This position is in a Salary Grade PM6 with a minimum starting salary of $70,916 per annum. The successful candidate’s salary will be calculated based on education and experience within the grade range.  
  
This position is eligible for full-time fringe benefits package including:  

* College-paid health insurance premiums for single, employee/spouse, employee/children or family plans
* College-paid employee dental premiums
* College paid life insurance and long-term disability insurance
* Competitive rates for vision plans and dependent dental
* Up to 9.5% matching on 403(b) retirement plan
* BestCare EAP
* Flex spending plans
* Generous leave package

  

**Campus**

Online

  

**General Description**

Supervised by the Executive Director of Data and Strategic Analytics, the Data Analyst supports a variety of department activities that promote a culture of evidence at Northeast Community College. Responsibilities include producing key dashboards and analyses for college-wide use, operational reporting for administrative and student services, academic departments, and other entities, in addition to research and reporting to support planning and institutional effectiveness.

The Data Analyst plays a key role in delivering actionable insights by managing, analyzing, and visualizing data to support strategic decision-making. The Data Analyst will have strong technical expertise and a solid understanding of student information system (SIS) and learning management system (LMS) data structures and reporting needs in a higher education setting. The analyst will support the integration and development of Power BI dashboards to enhance strategic decision-making and campus data literacy. Responsibilities include analyzing data from multiple sources, interpreting results, and developing data models, reports, and dashboards that deliver actionable insights for college initiatives.

This position works under general direction to execute complex technical and professional tasks across varied contexts, ensuring data integrity, reliability, and accessibility while contributing to process enhancements and organizational growth.  
  
This position is remote.

  

**Qualifications: Education**

Bachelor’s Degree in Business Intelligence, Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, Mathematics, or a related field.

  

**Qualification:Experience**

* One or more years of experience in advanced analytics or predictive modeling in the higher education setting.
* Three or more years of experience in data analysis, modeling, and visualization.
* Proficiency in tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar visualization platforms.
* Proficiency in SQL, Python, R, or other relevant programming languages.
* Strong analytical, organizational, and communication skills.

  

**Qualification:Skills**

* Data Modeling and Design
  + Applies data modeling and design techniques based on organizational requirements.
  + Develops, maintains, and explains data structures and associated components to support decision-making.
* Data Engineering
  + Assists in the development and implementation of data pipelines and storage systems.
  + Ensures the security, accessibility, and retrievability of data.
* Data Visualization
  + Designs and prototypes data visualizations using appropriate tools and techniques.
  + Refines visualizations through user feedback to support decision-making and storytelling.
* Data Analytics
  + Gathers and prepares data from diverse sources to support advanced analytics.
  + Applies statistical methods and tools to analyze data, identify trends, and develop actionable insights.
* Business Intelligence
  + Sources, prepares, and validates data for standard business intelligence activities.
  + Delivers reports aligned with stakeholder needs and organizational standards.
  + Identifies opportunities for improved business intelligence tools and processes.

  

**Special Instructions to Applicants**

Application review will begin immediately and Northeast Community College reserves the right to close the search at any time without prior notice to applicants.

06/04/2025

  

**Close Date**

  

**Open Until Filled**

Yes

title: Program Analyst III
description:
**Job Summary:**

The Program Analyst III will lead and execute comprehensive manpower studies and force management initiatives for the U.S. Army Intelligence and Security Command (INSCOM), G-3 Force Management Branch. This role supports mission-critical analysis and documentation efforts to ensure operational effectiveness of Echelon Above Corps (EAC) intelligence units through structured analysis, stationing support, and intra/inter-office task synchronization.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Manpower Studies & Force Management (PWS 5.1)**

* Execute the full five-phase manpower requirements determination process in accordance with AR 570-4.
* Lead research on organizational missions, roles, and functions to inform workload analysis.
* Train Major Subordinate Commands (MSCs) in creating Baseline Submission Packets (BSPs).
* Collect, validate, and analyze data; develop reports, recommendations, and presentation materials.
* Assist in developing Change Management Plans (CMPs), CPLAN products, and Total Army Analysis (TAA) documentation.
* Validate TDA/MTOE authorizations and develop Plan of Action and Milestones (POAMs).
* Draft OPORDs and FRAGOs and monitor equipping 4610-R requests and BOIPs.

**Intra-/Inter-Office Task Management & Program Support (PWS 5.2)**

* Coordinate and manage G-3 FM responses to INSCOM and HQDA taskings using ETMS2 and other Army task tools.
* Maintain task trackers, calendars, distribution lists, training records, and rosters.
* Support development and coordination of task orders, conferences, SOPs, and briefings.
* Oversee daily contractor performance, ensuring high quality deliverables and compliance with contract performance thresholds.
Provide inputs to monthly status reports (MSRs), trip reports, and executive summaries.  
* Position is pending award with a tentative start of March 2026.

Compensation Minimum: $115,000

Compensation Maximum: $122,000

Job Requirements:

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* **Experience:** 10+ years in workload analysis, force management, organizational structure analysis, or related roles (at least 2 years recent).
* **Education:** Bachelor’s degree or additional 2 years of experience in lieu of degree.
* **Certifications/Desirable:** HTAR Course, FA50 training.
* **Skills:**
* + In-depth knowledge of manpower and stationing processes (TDA, MTOE, CMP, CPLAN, FDU, TAA).
  + Proficiency in Army regulations including AR 570-4, AR 71-32, and DA PAM 71-32.
  + Strong briefing, analytical, and documentation skills using Microsoft Office Suite.
  + Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
  + Familiarity with Military Decision-Making Process (MDMP).

**Additional Requirements:**

* Must maintain a current TS/SCI clearance.
* Willingness to complete CI Polygraph if required.
* Must meet training and security compliance per DoD, INSCOM, and Army directives (e.g., TARP, OPSEC, ATCTS).
* Occasional CONUS/OCONUS travel required (approx. 8 trips annually).

**Location: Fort Belvoir, VA**

**Physical Requirements:**

Work may involve sitting or standing for extended periods of time. Position may require typing and reading from a computer screen. Must have sufficient mobility, including but not limited to bending, reaching, and kneeling to complete daily duties in a timely and efficient manner. May include lifting weight up to 25 pounds as necessary.

title: Business Analyst, Data Management- MIS
description:
At American Express, our culture is built on a 175-year history of innovation, shared values and Leadership Behaviors, and an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities, and colleagues. As part of Team Amex, you’ll experience this powerful backing with comprehensive support for your holistic well-being and many opportunities to learn new skills, develop as a leader, and grow your career.

Here, your voice and ideas matter, your work makes an impact, and together, you will help us define the future of American Express.

Our Data Management Team within Global Servicing MIS supports end to end data lifecycle journey for our business teams. This includes platform ownership, strategy, governance, ingestions, ETL builds, Data Quality, BI & downstream data enablement in collaboration with tech organization.

**How will you make an impact in this role?**

* Understanding business use cases and be able to convert to product roadmap & technical design
* Part of a cross-disciplinary team, working closely with other data engineers, data scientists, data managers and business analysts.
* Act as the liaison between business stakeholders and tech teams, ensuring clear communication of product vision and priorities.
* Own and manage the product backlog. Collaborate with Scrum teams in sprint planning, stand-ups, reviews etc.
* You will continuously monitor, troubleshoot, and improve data pipelines and workflows to ensure optimal performance and cost-effectiveness.
* Reviewing architecture and design on various aspects like scalability, security, design patterns, user experience, non-functional requirements and ensure that all relevant best practices are followed.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* 2- 4 years of experience as a Product Owner, Business Analyst or similar roles.
* Proven experience driving results utilizing a Forward Thinking Growth Minset, strategically.
* Deep proficiency in Analytical & Criical Thinking
* Excellent communication, facilitation and stakeholder management skills

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* 1-3 years of experience in Design, Development and Implementation of Data Products or Pipelines for Data Warehousing Applications Experience, within American Express

Salary Range: $70,000.00 to $135,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits

The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we’ll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.

We back you with benefits that support your holistic well-being so you can be and deliver your best. This means caring for you and your loved ones' physical, financial, and mental health, as well as providing the flexibility you need to thrive personally and professionally:

title: Senior Data Governance Analyst
description:
The senior data governance analyst is responsible for implementing and operationalizing data governance policies and procedures to ensure the integrity, availability and accuracy of Allied’s organizational data. They will collaborate with cross-functional teams to manage data quality improvements, consult with data governance best practices, and maintain compliance with regulatory requirements. They help foster a culture of data literacy through rolling out of data governance communication plan and data literacy activities.

**Job Duties and Responsibilities:**
------------------------------------

**Data Analysis (30%):**
------------------------

* Review and analyze complex data sets for data quality issues and data management challenges.
* Identify data quality improvement and develop a plan for remediation.
* Design and build data quality control structures to enable proactive data quality management that aligns with Allied’s data governance policies and regulatory compliance requirements.

**Data Governance Platform (20%):**

* Oversee management of business glossaries, data definitions, data rules, and data standards.
* Manage the data quality metrics integration into the data governance platform.

**Data Governance Program/Framework (20%):**

* Consult on data governance program initiatives in assessing the organizational impact and project planning.
* Work along with the manager of data governance to help implement data governance framework that includes data quality management, data policies, and compliance.
* Assist in planning and managing the data governance and the AI council meetings.

**Collaboration (20%):**

* Collaborate with the Data Stewards/Business Stakeholders to ensure data governance policy adherence and issue resolution.
* Assist the data architects/data modelers with meta data management and alignment of data model to data governance standards.

**Data Literacy (10%):**

* Foster a culture of data governance awareness and accountability through data literacy initiatives.

**Qualifications (Education, Experience, Certifications & KSA):**
-----------------------------------------------------------------

* 5+ years of experience in data management, business analysis, analytics, or equivalent experience demonstrated through education, training, or work.
* Proficiency in advanced SQL to query, review, and validate data is required.
* Advanced Excel skills for data analysis and reporting are required.
* Experience in a data governance platform (e.g. Informatica or Alation) is required.
* Experience in a data analysis platform (e.g. Tableau or Power BI) is required.
* Passionate about data, ability to manage multiple tasks, problem solving, and thinking out of the box skills are required.
* Understanding of data governance frameworks, data lineage, and regulatory requirements is strongly preferred.
* Experience in Python or R is preferred.
* Strong problem-solving abilities to translate data insights into actionable strategies.
* Ability to communicate complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

*The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, skills, efforts or working conditions associated with a job.*

We offer our employees a robust compensation package! Our comprehensive benefits include: medical, dental and vision insurance coverage; 100% company-paid life and disability coverage, 401k options with company match, three weeks PTO by the end of the first year and much more. Allied proudly promotes from within as part of a strong commitment to providing career growth opportunities for employees of all levels. Our diverse business portfolio allows employees broad career options with the advantage of staying with the same organization.
  
  
All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
company_description: Allied Solutions is proud to be one of the largest providers of insurance, lending & marketing products to financial institutions in the US.

title: ECONOMIC ANALYST
description:
***A resume helps you stand out to hiring managers and recruiters; your resume communicates your experience and your brand. While it is not required, we encourage you to include an up-to-date resume along with a completed job application to give you the best opportunity to be considered. A complete resume helps us to better understand your unique background, relevant experiences, and passions. We look forward to learning about you.***

  

Norfolk Southern offers a unique opportunity to be part of our proud legacy that spans nearly 200 years. We are a customer-centric, operations-driven team dedicated to advancing safety, serving communities, and driving innovation for tomorrow's rail. As part of Norfolk Southern, you’ll join a collaborative team where there are opportunities for growth across the organization. We are building a culture where everyone can thrive by owning and driving exceptional results, being humble and leading with trust, serving our customers with excellence, and collaborating and coaching to win.

  

**Job Description:**

Provide the Marketing division, and other NS departments with economic, industry, statistical and forecast information to support critical decision-making. Analyze data from internal and external sources to develop relevant insights in a variety of formats for NS stakeholders.

  

**Principal Duties:**

* Prepare research materials to support business development and validate areas of broader business strategy as determined by Marketing leadership. Work includes researching data sources, analyzing and interpreting relevant data, and developing recommendations.
* Assess business, competitive, and economic climates. Identify potential impacts on NS.
* Use statistical methods and tools to develop macro-economic forecast models used by Marketing in the development of the corporate demand forecast. Also, prepare statistical forecasts for long-term infrastructure planning and other special projects.
* Assist Marketing teams in the application and interpretation of economic and other forward-looking information to support the development of the corporate forecast.
* Utilize computer-based analytic tools including mapping programs, databases, websites, and dashboards to provide business intelligence to a wide variety of users.
* Prepare reports, speeches, data, and other materials to assess NS' current performance, competitor actions, and economic and business conditions.
* Support Marketing teams in the application of NS' forecasting system.

  

**Job Related Experience:**

Minimum Level: 1-2 years

  

**Education:**

Preferred Level: Master's Degree (MBA, MS)

Preferred Majors:

* Economics
* Finance
* Marketing
* Computer and Information Sciences
* Mathematical Sciences - Probability & Statistics

  

**Technical Skills:**

* MS Excel/Spreadsheets
* MS Access/Database Development
* MS PowerPoint/Presentations
* Tableau

  

**Skills and Abilities:**

* Analytical Thinking
* Written Communication
* Identifying and Considering Alternatives
* Presenting/Public Speaking

  

**Work Conditions**

Environment: Hybrid

Travel Required: 0 - 2 Days per Month

**Company Overview**

Since 1827, Norfolk Southern Corporation (NYSE: NSC) and its predecessor companies have safely moved the goods and materials that drive the U.S. economy. Today, it operates a customer-centric and operations-driven freight transportation network. Committed to furthering sustainability, Norfolk Southern helps its customers avoid 15 million tons of yearly carbon emissions by shipping via rail. Its dedicated team members deliver more than 7 million carloads annually, from agriculture to consumer goods, and is the largest rail shipper of auto products and metals in North America. Norfolk Southern also has the most extensive intermodal network in the eastern U.S., serving a majority of the country’s population and manufacturing base, with connections to every major container port on the Atlantic coast as well as the Gulf of Mexico and Great Lakes.

  

At Norfolk Southern, we believe in celebrating our individuality. By leveraging the unique backgrounds and viewpoints of our employees, we can create a culture of innovation, respect, and inclusion. We know that employees thrive in a workplace where differing viewpoints, ideas, and experiences are freely shared and valued. As such, we encourage all employees to contribute their distinctive skills and capabilities to our organization.

  

**Equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants regardless of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetic information, veteran status, sexual orientation, and gender identity. Together, we power progress.**
company_addresses: 650 W Peachtree St NW, Atlanta, GA 30308
company_description: Headquartered in Atlanta, GA, Norfolk Southern Corp is a Class 1 railroad that transports freight across 22 states and parts of Canada.

title: Sr. Product Analyst
description:
With over $3 billion in bookings of experiences, the Peek.com platform combines powerful business software with an award-winning marketplace for consumers to book fun things to do like wine tours, watersports, skydiving, art classes, and more.

The Peek Pro software suite provides world-class online booking, point-of-sale, and hundreds of automation tools such as inventory management, dynamic pricing, waivers, and marketing analytics. Thousands of operators like the Museum of Ice Cream, Artechouse, and Jam NOLA have grown their businesses and automated their operations with our technology.

Peek follows a “remote-first” philosophy, with our team of over 250 Peeksters distributed across exciting locales such as San Francisco, New York, Austin, Nashville, Salt Lake City, Santiago, Medellin, and beyond. Having secured funding exceeding $100 million from esteemed backers like Westcap and Goldman Sachs, we continue our mission to connect the world through experiences.

PS: In 2021, Peek was not only recognized with a coveted position on Forbes America's Best Startups Employer list but also celebrated an honor from

title: Data Analyst
description:
**Job Summary:**

We are looking for a detail-oriented and analytical Data Analyst to collect, process, and perform statistical analyses on large datasets. The ideal candidate has a strong foundation in data analytics, critical thinking skills, and the ability to transform data into actionable insights to support strategic decision-making.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Collect, clean, and validate data from multiple sources to ensure accuracy and reliability.
* Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform business decisions.
* Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and data visualizations using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
* Work closely with stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
* Create and maintain documentation related to data processes and analytics.
* Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to uncover new business opportunities.
* Assist in designing and implementing data models and databases for optimal performance.



**Required Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
* Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages such as SQL, Excel, Python, or R.
* Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.
* Strong understanding of statistical methods and data modelling techniques.
* Ability to work with large datasets and manage multiple tasks effectively.
* Strong communication skills with the ability to present complex information clearly.

title: Data Analyst
description:
**Responsibilities**
Kforce's client in Aurora, CO is seeking a strategic, data-driven professional to join their team as a Senior Data Analyst. This role is fully remote, and candidates can sit anywhere nationwide, although MST or PST time zones are preferred. Summary: This role is responsible for gathering, preparing, and analyzing data to support informed decision-making across business and clinical functions. The ideal candidate will bring advanced analytical expertise, a collaborative mindset, and a passion for turning complex data into actionable insights. Key Responsibilities:
  
  

* Identify and evaluate emerging trends in health insurance and healthcare
* Lead and mentor cross-functional teams while promoting continuous learning and adaptability
* Manage and execute complex projects aligned with business priorities and compliance standards
* Interpret complex data analyses and deliver insights through reports and presentations
* Develop and implement advanced statistical models to support strategic decisions
* Apply innovative analytics to define, validate, and analyze complex metrics and algorithms
* Prepare high-quality datasets by integrating, cleaning, and validating data from multiple sources
* Collect and update data systematically using tools, documentation, and user training
* Collaborate with stakeholders to define business needs, develop analysis plans, and evaluate outcomes

**Requirements**

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent years of applicable experience
* Minimum of 5 years of related experience
* SQL, Python, and Power BI experience
* Proven experience in data analysis, statistical modeling, and project leadership
* Strong communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into clear insights

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Certification in one of the following preferred: Oracle Business intelligence (OBI), EMC Data Science Associate (EMCDSA), Certified Authorization Professional (CAP), or Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE)
* Health insurance industry experience is preferred

The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.
  
  
We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.
  
  
Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.
  
  
This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.
  
  
Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.
  
  
By clicking “Apply Today” you agree to receive calls, AI-generated calls, text messages or emails from Kforce and its affiliates, and service providers. Note that if you choose to communicate with Kforce via text messaging the frequency may vary, and message and data rates may apply. Carriers are not liable for delayed or undelivered messages. You will always have the right to cease communicating via text by using key words such as STOP.

title: Data Analyst
description:
We are seeking a strong Data Analyst with excellent SQL, API and Data Mapping experience.

**Since this is a 100% remote job, we expect the candidate to have 100% of the following skills.**

**US Citizens or Green Card Holders ONLY!!**

**No C2C**

**No Third Party Agencies**

As a Senior Software Analyst on the Cloud Data Engineering team, you will be responsible for evaluating business requests to determine feasibility, identifying options, and recommending solutions for software development or enhancements. You will assist with interpreting customer requirements into conceptual and logical design specifications. You will play a role in shaping product design by gathering, interpreting, reviewing, validating, documenting, and maintaining business and functional requirements across our data environment to support product development. This will also include using SQL queries to perform gap/risk analysis and functional testing to support our products. At times, you will provide support and troubleshoot the team’s applications and products.

You will assist with developing interfaces and prototypes, recommending changes to meet requirements, and researching and documenting application/services issues. You will be in a position to provide instruction and guidance to less senior team members on new tasks and assignments.

Additionally, you will be involved in data mapping. This is essential for various data management tasks, such as data migration, integration, transformation, and warehousing.

In this role, you will be asked to research and present information in response to questions related to business standards. You may participate in testing, identifying potential problems and researching opportunities to minimize complexity. You will actively investigate, interpret, collaborate, understand and document the application/service functionality from the business perspective. It is imperative that you acknowledge and interpret the business goals, objectives, report improvements through system enhancements, process improvements and issue resolution.

To be successful, you will need to demonstrate strong personal ownership and accountability, relationship management, team building, organization, prioritization, problem-solving, change management, executive-level written, and oral communication.

Qualifications:

• 3+ years of SQL experience

• Experience in data mapping and data validation

• Experience working with Agile methodology or KANBAN

• Strong knowledge of Word, Excel, PowerPoint Point and Visio 2010

• Basic knowledge of JIRA/Confluence or another Project Tracking System

• Familiarity with regression testing, release testing, and/or troubleshooting system issues

• Experience complying with data security standards and working with enterprise-wide systems

• Must be organized with the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously and adhere to timelines

• Must have strong attention to detail and ability to document both system design information and processes

• Ability to identify root cause and conduct initial investigation into problems as they arise

• Must have proven experience in communicating and collaborating with all levels of management

• Ability to partner with software development team members to communicate a detailed understanding of requirements

• Ability to clearly define and create detailed documentation to describe complex business processes to the lowest level

• Ability to validate that new software releases are production ready and provide documentation for it to end users

• Consistently demonstrates personal ownership of tasks, projects and job performance

Preferred:

• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Management Information Systems, or related field preferred

• Experience with SQL on Teradata, Oracle, and/or SQL server

• Experience with API requirements analysis and design

• Experience with or willingness to learn new cloud technologies
